sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  REGION 5027 (S24W61) CONTINUED TO DECAY SLOWLY.  ACTIVITY IN THIS REGION HAS DECREASED OVER THE PAST DAY.  REGION 5032 (N17E39) CONTINUES TO GROW.  ADDITIONAL SUNSPOTS AND INCREASED MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY HAVE DEVELOPED DURING THE PAST DAY.  THIS REGION WAS KEPT AS A SINGLE NUMBERED REGION TODAY BECAUSE OF THE AMOUNT OF GROWTH; HOWEVER, IT IS NOW BELIEVED TO BE A COMPOUND REGION COMPOSED OF TWO SEPARATE SUNSPOT GROUPS WHICH HAVE GROWN TOGETHER.  REGION 5032 HAS PRODUCED A FEW C-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS AND OPTICAL SUBFLARES.  NEW REGION 5034 (S21E69) ROTATED AROUND THE LIMB AS A SMALL D-TYPE SUNSPOT GROUP. UNCONFIRMED REPORTS INDICATE THAT THERE MAY BE ANOTHER SUNSPOT GROUP ROUNDING THE EAST LIMB JUST TO THE SOUTH OF 5034.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  THE POSSIBILITY OF ENERGETIC ACTIVITY FROM REGION 5027 HAS DECREASED.  MODERATE ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5032 IF IT CONTINUES TO DEVELOP.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD AT MIDDLE LATITUDES HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND MOSTLY ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5027 (S24W72) DEVELOPED IN THE TRAILER PORTION AND PRODUCED SEVERAL SMALL C-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS AND SUBFLARES IN THE PAST 24 HOURS BUT NO SIGNIFICANT GROWTH OR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN REPORTED. REGION 5032 (N18E25) REMAINED STABLE AND PRODUCED ONLY A FEW SMALL X-RAY BURSTS AND SUBFLARES. ALL OTHER REGIONS ARE STABLE OR DECLINING, AND THE LIMBS ARE QUIET. NO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED.

sections.text: LOW. ENERGETIC EVENTS ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5027 FOR THE NEXT 2 DAYS, UNTIL IT ROTATES BEYOND WEST LIMB. THE PROBABILITY OF M-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS AND FLARES FROM REGION 5032 IS DECREASING AS THE REGION BEGINS A SLOW DECAY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET ON JUNE 3. A DISAPPEARING FILAMENT ON MAY 31 IS EXPECTED TO RESULT IN GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ON JUNE 4 AND 5.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  ONLY SUBFLARES HAVE BEEN OBSERVED TODAY, PRIMARILY FROM REGION 5027 (S24W82) WHICH IS PRESENTLY CROSSING THE WEST LIMB.  BESIDES 5027, THERE ARE 5 OTHER SPOTTED REGIONS ON THE DISK INCLUDING NEW REGION 5035 (N14W28) WHICH IS EMERGING RAPIDLY.  REGION 5032 (N18E13) DEVELOPED INTERMEDIATE SPOTS OF BOTH POLARITIES AND IS NOW THE MOST INTERESTING REGION OBSERVABLE.  SURGING ON THE WEST LIMB NEAR S23 MARKED THE DEPARTURE OF REGION 5028; THE EAST LIMB WAS QUIET.  A LARGE FILAMENT DISAPPEARED FROM THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT LATE ON 2 JUNE.  ITS POSITION ON 1 JUNE AT 1430 UT WAS APPROXIMATELY S36W28 TO S50W00.  MOST OF THE FILAMENT HAD FADED BY 02 JUNE 1700 UT.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: CONTINUE LOW.  REGIONS 5032 AND 5027 ARE THE ONLY REGIONS WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS X-RAY FLARES.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS IN RESPONSE TO A FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE ON 31 MAY.  QUIET CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO RESUME ON 6 JUNE.

sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5027 (S24W96) PRODUCED A LONG LIVED M3 AT 04/0745Z. A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM WAS OBSERVED AT S25W90 WITH THIS EVENT. WEAK TYPE II EMISSION WAS OBSERVED 04/0435-0441Z ALONG WITH A C5 X-RAY BURST FROM AN UNKNOWN REGION. REGION 5035 (N14W39) CONTINUED TO EMERGE AND IS NOW A CLASS C GROUP. sections.text: FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. AN ISOLATED CLASS M FLARE IS REMOTELY POSSIBLE FROM SEVERAL DISK REGIONS. REGION 5035 COULD BECOME AN M FLARE PRODUCER SHOULD GROWTH CONTINUE FOR AT LEAST TWO DAYS.

sections.text: SHOULD BE UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD SHOULD BE MORE DISTURBED WITH ACTIVE TO LOW MINOR STORM LEVELS EXPECTED FOR THE PERIOD. DISAPPEARING FILAMENTS AND THE M3 FLARE ARE THE PRIMARY REASONS FOR THIS FORECAST.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. NUMEROUS SUBFLARES WERE OBSERVED FROM A VARIETY OF REGIONS DURING THE PERIOD. THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A C2/SF FLARE AT 08/1635Z FROM REGION 5032 (N19W58). MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS ACCOMPANIED THE EVENT. REGION 5036 (S17E31) DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD AND BEGAN SUBFLARING, PARTICULARLY DURING THE SECOND HALF OF THE PERIOD. THUS FAR NO SIGNIFICANT X-RAY OR RADIO EMISSIONS HAVE BEEN OBSERVED FROM THIS REGION. MORE MODEST RATES OF GROWTH WERE OBSERVED WITHIN REGIONS 5038 (S25W62) AND 5040 (N27W35). NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5042 (S17W05) EMERGED AS A SIMPLE BIPOLE EARLY IN THE PERIOD.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. M-CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5036, ESPECIALLY IF ITS PRESENT RATE OF GROWTH CONTINUES.

sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5036 (S17E18) CONTINUED TO GRADUALLY INCREASE IN AREAL EXTENT AND SPOT NUMBER WITH MOST OF THE ADDITIONAL SPOTS FORMING NEAR THE CENTER OF THE GROUP. THUS FAR, THE REGION HAS BEEN RELATIVELY QUIET WITH ITS LARGEST FLARE BEING A C4/SN AT 08/2248Z. REGION 5032 (N19W71) PRODUCED THE MOST SIGNIFICANT EVENT OF THE PERIOD: A C9/1F FLARE AT 09/1706Z. A DARK SURGE WAS OBSERVED DURING THE EVENT WHICH EXTENDED FROM THE REGIONS'S CENTER WESTWARD ACROSS THE LIMB. THERE WERE ALSO MINOR DISCRETE FREQUENCY RADIO BURSTS OBSERVED DURING THE FLARE. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5043 (N29E16) EMERGED AS A SIMPLE BIPOLE AND HAS REMAINED STABLE DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS VERY LOW. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5047 (S15E72) WAS SEEN ROTATING ONTO THE DISK AT THE SOUTHERN LIMB WHILE REGION 5048 (N37E73) WAS SEEN NEAR THE NORTHERN LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW. THE VERY SHARPLY KINKED FILAMENT IN REGION 5036 (S18W48) STILL PROVIDES A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF MODERATE ACTIVITY FROM THAT REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. BRIEF MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES HALF WAY THROUGH THE PERIOD. THIS DISTURBANCE PROBABLY WAS IN RESPONSE TO THE C2/0F EVENT OF 11/0656Z WITH A COINCIDENT CORONAL MASS EJECTION AND TYPE II RADIO SWEEP.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED AS IT RECOVERS FROM THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW, HOWEVER THERE WAS ONE INTERESTING EVENT. A FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE SOUTH OF REGION 5036 WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A LONG DURATION CLASS C3 XRAY EVENT AT 15/0458UT AND A CORONAL MASS EJECTION. THERE WAS ALSO AN ASSOCIATED WEAK TYPE II RADIO BURST AND A SUBFLARE IN REGION 5036 (S18W60). REGION 5036 HAS SINCE STARTED TO DECAY SLOWLY. REGION 5047 (S17E60) HAS A SUNSPOT GROUP OF CLASS/AREA DSO/310 THAT MAY CONTAIN A WEAK DELTA CONFIGURATION. THIS REGION HAS NOT PRODUCED ANY FLARES. TWO SMALL REGIONS DEVELOPED ON THE DISK AND WERE NUMBERED TODAY. REGION 5049 (S30E28) AND 5050 (S22E45). ALL OTHER REGIONS ARE STABLE OR DECLINING.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: REMAIN LOW. REGION 5047 COULD PRODUCE AN M CLASS XRAY EVENT IN THE NEXT 3 DAYS IF IT CONTINUES TO DEVELOP IN SIZE AND COMPLEXITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: A PROTON ENCHANCEMENT AT 10MEV WAS OBSERVED FROM 0610 TO 0855UT, IT DID NOT REACH THE EVENT THRESHOLD. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE OF THIS ENHANCEMENT WAS THE EVENT IN REGION 5036 WHICH WAS LOCATED AT A FAVORABLE LONGITUDE FOR PROTONS TO REACH THE EARTH (W59). THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS. A GEOMAGNETIC DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED FROM THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENT, CME, AND TYPE II RADIO BURST AT 15/0458UT. THE DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE ON 17 JUNE AND IS EXPECTED TO REACH MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS ON 18 JUNE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  FLARES OCCURRED IN A NUMBER OF REGIONS DURING THE INTERVAL WITH THE LARGEST EVENT A C8/0B FROM REGION 5047 (S16E47) AT 15/2245Z.  THAT REGION AND REGION 5041 (N13W41) HAVE GROWN IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA DURING THE LAST 24 HOURS.  TWO NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED, REGIONS 5051 (N34E39) AND 5052 (N30E41).  BOTH ARE SIMPLE IN STRUCTURE BUT ARE INTERESTING DUE TO THEIR PROXIMITY TO OLD MATURE REGION 5048 (N37E51).  THE X-RAY AND 10 CM. BACKGROUND VALUES INCREASED DURING THE DAY.  SURGING WAS NOTED AT EAST LIMB NEAR S26.  SIGNIFICANT RESTRUCTURING HAS OCCURRED IN A LARGE FILAMENT POSITIONED NEAR S60W20.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 5041, 5047, AND 5048.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MID- LATITUDES.  HIGH LATITUDES EXPERIENCED GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS.  AN EPISODE OF MINOR STORM LEVELS OCCURRED THERE EARLY IN THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BECOME DISTURBED IN THE NEXT 12 TO 24 HOURS DUE TO FLARE ACTIVITY ON JUNE 15.  MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS SHOULD THEN PREVAIL FOR ABOUT A DAY AND GRADUALLY SUBSIDE BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY REMAINS LOW.  THE MOST ENERGETIC EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS A C6/1N FLARE AT 0404Z FROM REGION 5047 (S15E34).  SMALL DISCRETE FREQUENCY RADIO BURSTS - I.E., 65 FLUX UNITS AT 2695 MHZ - AND TYPE IV SWEEP WERE RECORDED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE FLARE.  THE REGION HAS BEEN STABLE SINCE THAT EVENT.  OTHER SPOTTED REGIONS HAVE BEEN STABLE OR DECLINING IN GENERAL.  NO NEW REGION WAS ASSIGNED IN THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: REMAIN LOW.  M-CLASS ACTIVITY, THOUGH NOT ANTICIPATED, IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5047.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN GENERALLY UNSETTLED AT MID- LATITUDES.  MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES, ALONG WITH A BRIEF PERIOD OF MINOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS THE FIRST DAY IN RESPONSE TO FLARE ACTIVITY ON JUNE 15.  THE DISTURBANCE IS THEN EXPECTED TO WEAKEN AND GIVE WAY TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS BY THE END OF THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUES AT A LOW LEVEL.  A C5/0F FLARE FROM REGION 5047 (S17E23) AT 0015Z WAS THE MOST ENERGETIC EVENT OF THE PERIOD.  THAT REGION EXHIBITS A MODERATE DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY AND HAS UNDERGONE RESTRUCTURING AND GROWTH IN WHITE LIGHT.  REGION 5041 (N14W66), PRODUCER OF A FEW SUBFLARES, ALSO IS SLIGHTLY COMPLEX IN STRUCTURE.  NEWLY NUMBERED REGION 5053 (S21E76) ROTATED INTO VIEW AS A SINGLE MATURE SPOT WITH PENUMBRA AND SOME PLAGE.  IT IS PROBABLY THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5027 WHICH GENERATED 6 M-CLASS FLARES IN ITS LIFETIME.  SURGING HERALDED ITS ARRIVAL ON THE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  REGION 5047 MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT IN THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MID- LATITUDES.  AT HIGH LATITUDES GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS GAVE WAY TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE PAST 6 HOURS.  THIS ACTIVITY IS THOUGHT TO BE RELATED TO THE FLARE/CME ACTIVITY OF JUNE 15.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD PERSIST AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE NEXT 24 HOURS.  THE LAST TWO DAYS OF THE INTERVAL ARE LIKELY TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  REGION 5047 (S15E09) AND REGION 5041 (N15W80) EACH PRODUCED MODEST C-CLASS EVENTS. BOTH REGIONS DECAYED IN GENERAL, BUT REGION 5047 RETAINS A SLIGHT DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.  A LARGE, BUSHY PROMINENCE GRADUALLY ASCENDED FROM S50W90 AROUND 1600Z.  THAT EVENT HAD NO ASSOCIATED X-RAY ENHANCEMENT.  THE OTHER FOUR SPOTTED REGIONS WERE STABLE.  NO NEW REGION WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: STAY AT A LOW LEVEL.  REGION 5047 MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENT IN THE NEXT 3 DAYS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 18/2100Z TO 19/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MID-LATITUDES.  CONDITIONS FLUCTUATED ABOUT THE MINOR STORM LEVEL AT HIGH LATITUDE SITES.  THE JUNE 15 FLARE/CME ACTIVITY IS LIKELY THE ORIGIN OF THIS DISTURBANCE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THROUGHOUT THE INTERVAL.  MID-LATITUDES MAY EXPERIENCE QUIET CONDITIONS JUNE 22.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. ONLY SMALL FLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD AND MOST OF THESE WERE FROM REGION 5047 (S15W02). REGION 5041 (N16W93) PRODUCED SURGE ACTIVITY AS IT ROTATED OUT OF VIEW. TWO NEW SMALL SUNSPOT GROUPS EMERGED ON THE DISK TODAY: REGION 5054 (S25E28) AND REGION 5055 (S24E36). THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. MAGNETICALLY COMPLICATED REGION 5047 POSES A SLIGHT THREAT FOR MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND WAS AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES EARLY IN THE DAY, BUT WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED AFTER APPROXIMATELY 20/1500Z. THE JUNE 15 FLARE/CME/DSF ACTIVITY IS LIKELY TO HAVE CAUSED THE DISTURBANCE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. AN INCREASE TO PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE LEVELS IS EXPECTED ON THE THIRD DAY DUE TO AN ISOLATED CORONAL HOLE WHICH SHOULD BE IN A FAVORABLE POSITION AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5047 (S15W15) PRODUCED SEVERAL SMALL FLARES TODAY: THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS WAS A C7.2/1N AT 0320Z. A LONG DURATION X-RAY EVENT AND A STRONG TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP WERE OBSERVED BETWEEN 0500-0800Z. SUPERPOSED ON THIS EVENT WAS A C7 FLARE AT 0529Z WHICH WAS TIME CORRELATED WITH SUBFLARES FROM EACH OF REGION 5054 (S25E16), 5055 (S24E22) AND 5047. REGION 5051 (N36W24) DISPLAYED SOME GROWTH TODAY BUT APPEARS TO HAVE STABILIZED AT THIS TIME. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 5047 CONTINUES TO POSE A SLIGHT THREAT FOR MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES TOMORROW. HOWEVER, LATE IN THE DAY AN INCREASE TO PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE LEVELS IS EXPECTED FROM THE EFFECT OF A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. THE DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE SOMETIME EARLY ON THE THIRD DAY.

THE REGION GREW SOMEWHAT DURING THE DAY, INCREASING IN AREA AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: GENERALLY LOW WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY FROM REGION 5047.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES. PERIODS OF ENHANCED ACTIVITY OCCURRED IN THE LATTER PART OF THE DAY. THIS ACTIVITY IS PROBABLY BEING CAUSED BY A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE LEVELS TOMORROW AS THE CURRENT CORONAL HOLE INDUCED DISTURBANCE CONTINUES. ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO DIMINISH TO GENERALLY UNSETTLED LEVELS WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN HIGH. REGION 5047 (S16W42) PRODUCED THREE MAJOR FLARES: AN M5.2/1N AT 22/2242Z, AN X1.6/2B AT 23/0926Z AND AN M8.1/1N AT 1802Z. THE REGION DEVELOPED A DELTA CONFIGURATION SOMETIME LATE ON THE 22ND WHICH HAS PERSISTED THROUGH THE DAY AND HAS BEEN THE MAIN DRIVER OF THE FLARES. THE REGION HAS CONTINUED TO GROW IN AREA. NEW REGIONS 5056 (S24E20) AND 5057 (N22E24) EMERGED ON THE DISK. NEW REGION 5058 (S18E75) ROTATED ONTO VIEW TODAY. A 23 DEGREE FILAMENT LOCATED FROM S31W05 TO S51W17 DISAPPEARED SOMETIME DURING THE PERIOD. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE ESSENTIALLY QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR HIGH LEVELS OF ACTIVITY. REGION 5047 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO PRODUCE EVENT LEVEL FLARES AS IT APPROACHES THE WEST LIMB AND DUE TO THE POSITIONING OF THE REGION THERE IS FAIR CHANCE THAT AN EVENT LEVEL FLARE COULD PRODUCE A PROTON EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES. PIONEER VENUS OBSERVED A SHOCK LATE YESTERDAY AFTERNOON. THE TIMING OF THE EVENT WAS PRIOR TO THE MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY, IMPLYING A CORRELATION WITH A HIGH SPEED STREAM FROM THE SOLAR CORONAL HOLE LOCATED IN THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD AT
sections.text: MIDDLE LATITUDES IS EXPECTED TO BE AT GENERALLY ACTIVE LEVELS WITH SOME MINOR STORM PERIODS TOMORROW. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THE DISTURBANCE IS FORECAST BECAUSE OF THE HIGH SPEED SHOCK OBSERVATION SEEN BY PIONEER VENUS (WHICH IS PROBABLY RELATED TO THE SW QUAD CORONAL HOLE) AND BECAUSE OF A POSSIBLE SUPERPOSITION OF SHOCKS FROM TODAY'S MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY. THE DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS WITH MID-LATITUDES AT UNSETTLED TO OCCASIONALLY ACTIVE LEVELS AND HIGH LATITUDES GENERALLY ACTIVE WITH OCCASIONAL MINOR STORM PERIODS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN HIGH. REGION 5047 (S16W55) PRODUCED THREE X-CLASS X-RAY FLARES DURING THE PERIOD: AN X1/1B AT 0430Z, AN X2/2B AT 1609Z, AND AN X5/1B AT 1648Z. THE REGION CONTINUES TO BE VERY IMPRESSIVE WITH TWO DELTA CONFIGURATIONS, STRONG GRADIENTS AND EVIDENCE OF STRONG MAGNETIC SHEAR. THE X5 FLARE WAS MANIFEST AS A WHITE LIGHT FLARE AND LASTED FOR 91 MINUTES. STRONG DISCRETE FREQUENCY RADIO BURSTS (17000 SFU AT 245MHZ AND 340 SFU AT 2695MHZ) AND A STRONG TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP ACCOMPANIED THE EVENT. REGION 5051 (N37W63) PRODUCED SOME SMALL FLARES: THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C7.4/SF AT 1414Z WHICH WAS TIME CORRELATED WITH A TYPE II RADIO SWEEP. NEW REGION 5059 (N16E39) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY. SURGE ACTIVITY HAS BEEN REPORTED ON THE EAST LIMB AT ABOUT S20, CLOSE TO THE LATITUDE OF REGION 5058 (S18E63). THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 5047 IS EXPECTED TO KEEP ACTIVITY UP TO AT LEAST MODERATE LEVELS AND HAS A FAIR TO GOOD CHANCE OF PRODUCING ADDITIONAL X-CLASS FLARES. DUE TO THE POSITIONING OF OF THE REGION THERE IS A FAIR TO GOOD CHANCE THAT AN EVENT LEVEL FLARE COULD PRODUCE A PROTON EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 33 GAMMA WAS OBSERVED AT 0028Z. A MAGNETIC CROCHET WAS OBSERVED IN BOULDER AND WAS ASSOCIATED THE X5 FLARE MENTIONED ABOVE. THE CURRENT DISTUR- BANCE IS PROBABLY BEING CAUSED BY THE CORONAL HOLE LOCATED IN THE SOUTHWEST SOLAR QUADRANT. FLARE ACTIVITY FROM 23 MAY MAY ALSO BE A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TOMORROW AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES. AN INCREASE IN ACTIVITY TO MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS IS EXPECTED SOMETIME ON THE SECOND DAY AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE THIRD DAY IN RES- PONSE TO TODAY'S SOLAR FLARE. A PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED EARLY ON THE FIRST DAY AS WELL: GREATER THAN 10MEV PARTICLES ARE CURRENTLY PREDICTED TO PEAK AT ABOUT 300 PARTICLES/CM2/S/STER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN HIGH.  SEVERAL M-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS FROM REGION 5047 (S17W69) AND NEW REGION 5060 (S22E75).  REGION 5047 HAS ONLY PRODUCED LOW LEVEL M-CLASS ACTIVITY SINCE YESTERDAY'S X-CLASS FLARES; HOWEVER,  THIS REGION DOES NOT APPEAR TO HAVE DIMINISHED IN COMPLEXITY.  NEW REGION 5060 IS ROTATING AROUND THE EAST LIMB AS A LARGE COMPLEX SPOT GROUP. THIS REGION WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR AT LEAST TWO M-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS, THE LARGEST BEING AN M6/SB LIMB FLARE REACHING A MAXIMUM AT 25/1647UT.  MORE OF THIS REGION SHOULD ROTATE INTO VIEW BY TOMORROW.  REGION 5051 (N36W73) PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES SINCE YESTERDAY.  OTHER REGIONS WERE QUIET.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  REGION 5047 RETAINS POTENTIAL FOR X-CLASS X-RAY ACTIVITY.  M-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGION 5060, WITH A MODERATE CHANCE OF X-CLASS ACTIVITY FROM THIS REGION.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE.  THE X-RAY BACKGROUND FLUX HAS BEEN WELL ABOVE C-LEVEL FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, GRADUALLY SURPASSING M-LEVEL FOR ABOUT TWO AND A HALF HOURS BEGINNING AT 1600UT.  REGION 5047 (S16W82) APPEARS TO HAVE DECAYED SINCE YESTERDAY AND HAS ONLY PRODUCED ONE M-CLASS FLARE DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS, AN M1/1N REACHING A MAXIMUM AT 25/1355UT.  REGION 5060 (S19E63) IS A VERY LARGE AND COMPLEX LOOKING ACTIVE REGION, WITH A SUNSPOT AREA IN EXCESS OF 1000 CORRECTED MILLIONTHS OF THE SOLAR HEMISPHERE. THE LARGEST FLARE PRODUCED BY THIS REGION SINCE YESTERDAY WAS A C8/SF AT 25/0024UT.  NEW REGIONS 5061 (N27E75) AND 5062 (N13E72) ROTATED AROUND THE EAST LIMB AS A SINGLE H-TYPE SPOT AND A GROWING B-TYPE GROUP, RESPECTIVELY.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  THE POTENTIAL OF X-CLASS X-RAY FLARES FROM REGION 5047 HAS DECLINED.  REGION 5060 APPEARS CAPABLE OF SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY.  ADDITIONAL ANALYSIS IS REQUIRED TO ASSESS ITS FULL POTENTIAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE.  THE X-RAY BACKGROUND REMAINS WELL ABOVE THE C-CLASS X-RAY LEVEL.  REGION 5047 (S17W95) HAS ROTATED OUT OF VIEW BEYOND THE WEST LIMB WITHOUT PRODUCING ADDITIONAL MAJOR FLARES.  REGION 5060 (S20E50) HAS GROWN SINCE YESTERDAY AND NOW HAS A SUNSPOT AREA APPROACHING 2000 MILLIONTHS OF THE SOLAR HEMISPHERE.  DESPITE THE LARGE SPOTS AND STRONG MAGNETIC FIELDS, THE REGION HAS ONLY PRODUCED ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY SINCE ITS APPEARANCE ON THE DISK.  THE LARGEST FLARE IN THE PAST 24 HOURS FROM THIS REGION WAS AN M1/SN AT 26/0309UT.  THERE WAS ALSO A SUBFLARE IN REGION 5047 AT NEARLY THE SAME TIME.  A NEW BIPOLAR EMERGENCE IS LOCATED JUST TO THE WEST OF THE LEADER SPOT COMPLEX OF REGION 5060.  THERE ARE A FEW SMALL SUNSPOTS LOCATED HERE WHICH MAY BE NUMBERED AS A SEPARATE ACTVE REGION IF GROWTH CONTINUES.  REGION 5062 (N13E58) CONTINUES TO GROW RAPIDLY AND IS NOW A SMALL D-TYPE SPOT GROUP.  THIS REGION HAS BEEN UNUSUALLY ACTIVE FOR ITS SIZE, PRODUCING AN M1/SF FLARE AT 26/0606UT AND SEVERAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES.

sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  ENERGETIC ACTIVITY IS LIKELY FROM REGION 5060.  ISOLATE M-CLASS FLARES ARE POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5062.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE TO HIGH.  THERE WERE SIX M-CLASS X-RAY FLARES DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS, MOST OF WHICH WERE PRODUCED BY REGION 5060 (S19E36).  THIS REGION CONTINUES TO GROW AND DEVELOP IN COMPLEXITY.  SUNSPOT AREA IS NOW APPROACHING 2500 MILLIONTHS OF THE SOLAR HEMISPHERE.  SPOT UMBRA NEAR ONE OF THE REGION'S DELTA CONFIGURATIONS APPEAR TO BE DEVELOPING LATERALLY.  THIS MAY IMPLY INCREASED SHEAR WITHIN THE REGION AND A HIGHER LIKELIHOOD OF SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY.  REGION 5062 (N15E46) ALSO CONTINUES TO GROW AND IS NOW A DAI SUNSPOT GROUP.  A DELTA CONFIGURATION APPEARS TO BE FORMING IN THE CENTER OF THE REGION.  THIS REGION HAS HAD SEVERAL SUBFLARES AND HAS CONTRIBUTED TO AT LEAST TWO OF TODAY'S M-CLASS X-RAY FLARES. REMAINING REGIONS WERE QUIET.

sections.text: HIGH TO VERY HIGH.  THE LEVEL OF M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCTION IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE.  X-CLASS ACTIVITY, WITH THE POSSIBLE GENERATION OF ENERGETIC PARTICLES, IS LIKELY FROM REGION 5060.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 5060 (S20E23) CONTINUES TO PRODUCE M-CLASS X-RAY ACTIVITY.  THE LARGEST FLARE FROM THIS REGION IN THE PAST 24 HOURS WAS AN M6/2B AT 29/0741UT.  A STRONG TYPE II/IV RADIO SWEEP AND TENFLARE OF 370 SFU WAS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FLARE. THE REGION REMAINS QUITE COMPLEX AND THE CURRENT SUNSPOT AREA IS NEARLY 3000 MILLIONTHS OF THE SOLAR HEMISPHERE.  REGION 5062 (N12E31) PRODUCED SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES SINCE YESTERDAY BUT DID NOT GENERATE ANY M-LEVEL ACTIVITY.  GROWTH IN THIS REGION APPEARS TO BE SLOWING AND THE DELTA CONFIGURATION, WHICH WAS LOCATED IN THE CENTER OF THE REGION FOR A SHORT TIME YESTERDAY, IS NO LONGER PRESENT.  NEW REGION 5064 (N20W10) EMERGED AS A SINGLE SPOT OVER THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.text: HIGH TO VERY HIGH.  REGION 5060 COULD PRODUCE A SIGNIFICANT FLARE AT ANY TIME.  REGION 5062 MAY GENERATE ADDITIONAL M-CLASS X-RAY FLARES.

sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN HIGH TO VERY HIGH. REGION 5060 (S20E10) CONTINUED AS THE DOMINANT FEATURE ON THE DISK. IT PRODUCED AN M9/2B FLARE AT 30/0906Z ACCOMPANIED BY A STRONG TYPE II RADIO SWEEP BURST AND A TENFLARE OF 300 SFU. A BRIEF PERIOD OF DECAY WAS OBSERVED IN THE WAKE OF THE 2B FLARE, BUT THE REGION HAS SINCE STABILIZED AND REMAINS VERY COMPLEX IN ALL MORPHOLOGICAL ASPECTS. REGION 5062 (N13E17) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE C-CLASS FLARES THROUGH THE PERIOD AND IS CURRENTLY IN A SLOW GROWTH PHASE. THE SMM SATELLITE OBSERVED A CORONAL MASS EJECTION OFF THE EAST LIMB JUST NORTH OF THE EQUATOR NEAR 30/0930Z (NO VELOCITY AVAILABLE). NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: MODERATE TO VERY HIGH. REGION 5060 CONTINUES TO DISPLAY POTENTIAL FOR X-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY. THERE IS A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF M-LEVEL FLARING FROM REGION 5062.

sections.text: THE MIDDLE LATITUDE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN ACTIVE FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD FLUCTUATED BETWEEN MINOR AND MAJOR STORM LEVELS. A PROTON EVENT WAS OBSERVED AT GEOSYNCHRONOUS ALTITUDES. IT BEGAN AT 30/1055Z AND REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 21 P/CM2/SEC/STER AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV AT 30/1140Z. THE EVENT REMAINS IN PROGRESS AT THIS TIME.

sections.text: GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE TOMORROW INCREASING TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ON THE SECOND DAY THEN DECLINING TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS ON THE FINAL DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 5060 (S20W03) HAS BEEN RELATIVELY INACTIVE SINCE YESTERDAY'S M9/2B FLARE. HOWEVER, THE REGION HAS RETAINED ITS COMPLEXITY IN ALL ASPECTS. RECENT OBSERVATIONS NOTE THE PRESENCE OF MULTIPLE DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATIONS AND EXTREMELY TIGHT MAGNETIC GRADIENTS WITHIN THE REGION. THE REGION'S LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS A C6/2F FLARE AT 01/0849Z. REGION 5062 (N13E03) DISPLAYED SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN BOTH LEADER AND TRAILER PENUMBRAE. OCCASIONAL SUBFLARE ACTIVITY HAS BEEN OBSERVED WITHIN THE REGION. NEW REGION 5065 (N23E42) WAS ASSIGNED EARLY IN THE PERIOD. IT EMERGED AS AN A-TYPE SPOT BUT QUICKLY DEGENERATED TO PLAGE.

sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS A C5/SF FLARE FROM WITHIN REGION 5062 (N13W37). THEREAFTER, THE REGION REMAINED RELATIVELY QUIET AS IT BEGAN TO SLOWLY DECAY. GRADUAL DECAY CONTINUED WITHIN REGION 5060 (S20W41). ISOLATED SUBFLARE ACTIVITY OCCURRED WITHIN THE REGION THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. A VERY WEAK TYPE II RADIO SWEEP BURST WAS DETECTED AT 04/1336Z. THE SWEEP HAD NO OPTICAL OR X-RAY CORRELATION. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 5067 (S10W28) AND 5068 (N25E18). BOTH EMERGED AS UNIPOLAR GROUPS.

REGION 5060 (S19W79) PRODUCED A C6/1B FLARE AT 07/1455Z WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP. IT ALSO CONTINUED TO DECAY VERY SLOWLY. BOTH REGIONS 5062 AND 5060 RETAINED THEIR MORE COMPLICATED BETA-GAMMA AND BETA-GAMMA-DELTA CONFIGURATIONS RESPECTIVELY. REGION 5069 (N22E26) SUPPORTED ONE C-CLASS SUB- FLARE WITHOUT SIGNIFICANT RADIO ASPECTS AS IT EVOLVED SLIGHTLY INTO A BETA-GAMMA CONFIGURATION. NO NEW REGION WAS ASSIGNED, ALTHOUGH REGION 5068 (N30W23) REEMERGED WITH SIMPLE BETA SPOTS AFTER TWO DAYS OF SPOTLESS PLAGE.

IT IS APPARENTLY IN A DYNAMIC DECAY PHASE. THE M4/0N FLARE AT 08/1206Z WAS ITS LARGEST EVENT,AND HAD NO SIGNIFICANT RADIO ASPECTS. REGION 5060 (S17W89) CONTINUED TO SLOWLY DECAY AND AGAIN PRODUCED AN OVERNIGHT FLARE OF MODERATE STRENGTH. ITS M1/0N FLARE HAD AN ASSOCIATED 21 SFU TENFLARE BURST. NO NEW REGION WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5069 (N23W00) CONSISTENTLY PRODUCED C-CLASS SUBFLARES WITHOUT ANY SIGNIFICANT RADIO PARAMETERS. IT CONTINUED TO SLOWLY EVOLVE AND IT STILL RETAINED ITS BETA-GAMMA STRUCTURE. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5073 (N27E36) WAS A SMALL BETA-TYPE. THE OVERALL RISE IN FLUX LEVELS LATE IN THE PERIOD IMPLIED THAT THE RETURNING REGIONS WITHIN TWO DAYS OF THE EAST LIMB ARE ALREADY CONTRIBUTING TO THE BACKGROUND THRESHOLDS. FOUR NORTHERN FILAMENTS NEAR REGIONS 5065 AND 5068 (N26W60 AND N30W51 RESPECTIVELY) DISAPPEARED WITHIN THE LAST THREE DAYS. THEIR ACCUMULATIVE LENGTH WAS ABOUT 34 DEGREES. ANOTHER SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE FILAMENT NEAR S36 E08 DISAPPEARED IN THE SAME TIME FRAME. IT WAS ABOUT 14 DEGREES LONG.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGIONS 5062 (N13W108) AND 5060 (S17W102) ROTATED AROUND THE WEST LIMB BUT STILL PROVIDE A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF BOTH HIGH AND VERY HIGH ACTIVITY LEVELS THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD. INCREASING BACKGROUND X-RAY AND 10CM FLUX INDICES IMPLY THAT THE RETURNING REGIONS 5047 AND 5048 (S16, CAR-151 AND N38, CAR-146 RESPECTIVELY) MAY AGAIN PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT FLARE ACTIVITY. THE INCREASING FLARE PROBABILITIES THE LAST HALF OF THE PERIOD ARE BASED ON THEIR RETURN.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO QUIET. ONE ISOLATED MINOR STORM PERIOD OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES AT THE START OF THE DAY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED. A DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENTS. IT MAY ALSO CAUSE OCCASIONAL STORM CONDITIONS.

THE REGION HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNCHANGED IN STRUCTURE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.  REGION 5073 (N28E24) HAS GROWN SUBSTANTIALLY IN BOTH WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA AND ITS EMBEDDED ARCH-FILAMENTS SUGGEST MORE GROWTH YET TO COME. REGION 5071 (N24E32) HAS ALSO GROWN ALTHOUGH TO A LESSER DEGREE THAN NEARBY REGION 5073.  SURGING NEAR S15E90 MAY PRESAGE THE ARRIVAL OF OLD REGION 5047, THE SITE OF FOUR X-CLASS FLARES ON 23-24 JUNE.  THE BACKGROUND X-RAY FLUX IS ELEVATED ABOVE C-LEVEL AND HAS BEEN SO SINCE ABOUT 1300Z TODAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUES LOW TO MODERATE.  NEWLY NUMBERED REGION 5074 (S16E71) ROTATED INTO VIEW EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND PROMPTLY PRODUCED AN M2/1B FLARE AT 0041Z. THIS REGION IS THE EXPECTED RETURN OF OLD REGION 5047 WHICH SPAWNED FOUR X-CLASS EVENTS IN ITS LIFETIME. REGION 5047 CONSISTS OF BUT TWO WIDELY SEPARATED SUNSPOTS WITH PENUMBRA, ORIENTED MOSTLY NORTH-SOUTH.  LIMB PROXIMITY PROHIBITS ADEQUATE MAGNETIC ANALYSIS AT THIS WRITING.  THE OTHER DISK REGIONS WERE PREDOMINANTLY STABLE. REGIONS 5069 (N23W25) AND 5071 (N25E19) GENERATED OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES.  THE BACKGROUND X-RAY FLUX REMAINED NEAR C-LEVEL AGAIN TODAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW TO MODERATE.  REGIONS 5073 (N28W16) AND 5075 (S20E53) COMBINED TO GENERATE AN M1 X-RAY EVENT AT 0032Z.  THE H-ALPHA FLARES WERE CATEGORIZED AS ONE-NORMAL FROM REGION 5073 AND SUB-NORMAL FROM 5075. EACH REGION HAS PRODUCED OCCASIONAL SUBFLARES SINCE.  REGION 5071 (N24W08), ADJACENT TO REGION 5073, HAS ALSO YIELDED PERIODIC SUBFLARES.  THE WHOLE-SUN BACKGROUND X-RAY FLUX CONTINUES TO HOVER NEAR THE C-LEVEL.  STRUCTURALLY REGION 5075 IS THE MOST INTERESTING OF THE LOT.  IT CONSISTS OF A LARGE LEADER SPOT -VISIBLE TO THE NAKED EYE- AND APPROXIMATELY 20 LESSER SPOTS. MAGNETICALLY IT IS A BETA-DELTA WITH BOTH POLARITIES ENCLOSED IN A COMMON PENUMBRA IN THE SOUTH-CENTRAL PORTION OF THE GROUP. THAT LOCATION WAS THE SITE OF MUCH OF THE RECENT ACTIVITY.  THE LIMBS WERE QUIET THROUGHOUT THE INTERVAL.

sections.text: CONTINUE LOW TO MODERATE.  ISOLATED M-CLASS EVENTS ARE LIKELY FROM REGION 5075.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. NEW REGION 5076 (S16E18) EMERGED JUST TO THE NORTH OF REGION 5075 AND PRODUCED SOME SMALL FLARES. REGION 5075 (S21E15) CONTINUES TO BE THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK BUT PRODUCED ONLY SMALL FLARES AND APPEARS TO BE EVOLVING TO A SIMPLER MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. REGION 5069 (N24W93) PRODUCED SURGE ACTIVITY AS IT ROTATED AROUND THE WEST LIMB. ADDITIONAL SURGING WAS ALSO OBSERVED ON THE EAST LIMB AT APPROXIMATELY N20 AND S20. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 5075.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND RANGED FROM ACTIVE TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE DISTURBANCE APPEARS TO BE SUBSIDING AT THIS TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: IS EXPECTED TO PERSIST AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR TOMORROW. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5075 (S21W13) CONTINUES TO PRODUCE SMALL FLARES INCLUDING A C6.3/1F AT 1608Z AND A C4.6/1F AT 1625Z. THE LATTER OF THESE WAS CORRELATED WITH A STRONG TYPE IV RADIO SWEEP AND INTENSE DISCRETE FREQUENCY BURSTS. THE REGION APPEARS TO BE DECAYING SLIGHTLY BUT IS ALSO UNDERGOING SOME ROTATION WHICH IS LIKELY TO BE INCREASING MAGNETIC FIELD SHEARING AND HENCE THE STRENGTH AND FREQUENCY OF THE FLARES. REGIONS 5071 (N25W68) AND 5073 (N29W84) ALSO PRO- DUCED SOME SMALL FLARES AS THEY APPROACHED THE WEST LIMB. NEW REGION 5079 (S16W33) EMERGED TODAY AS A SIMPLE BIPOLAR GROUP AND NEW REGION 5080 (S18E61) ROTATED INTO VIEW AS A SIMPLE UNI- POLAR GROUP. RADIO NOISE STORMS WERE IN PROGRESS THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON 245 AND 410 MHZ WITH OCCASIONAL INTENSE BURSTS WHICH WERE FREQUENTLY ASSOCIATED WITH TODAY'S SUBFLARE ACTIVITY. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: GENERALLY LOW. NONETHELESS REGION 5075 CONTINUES TO POSE SOME- WHAT OF A THREAT FOR MODERATE LEVELS AND MAY PRODUCE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE SOMETIME OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS AS IT CONTINUES TO DECAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED WITH A PERIOD OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO STORM CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES FROM APPROXIMATELY 0300-1200Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES. A CORONAL HOLE LOCATED JUST SOUTHWEST OF REGION 5075 MAY INCREASE LEVELS SLIGHTLY ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5075 (S21W27) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE SMALL C-CLASS FLARES: THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS A C9.4/1N AT 0037Z. THE REGION IS CONTINUING TO GRADUALLY DECAY. A LONG DURATION X-RAY ENHANCEMENT OCCURRED FROM ABOUT 0400Z TO 1500Z WITH A MAXIMUM FLUX OF ABOUT C5 AT APPROXIMATELY 0700Z. NO CORRESPONDING OPTICAL SIGNATURE OF THE EVENT WAS OBSERVED. REGION 5071 (N24W86) IS PRODUCING ACTIVE SURGING AS IT ROTATES FROM VIEW. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  REGION 5075 (S21W35) REMAINS THE MOST IMPRESSIVE REGION ON THE DISK BUT COULD ONLY PRODUCE A FEW LOW LEVEL C-CLASS X-RAY FLARES DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.  OVERALL SUNSPOT AREA HAS CHANGED LITTLE BUT THERE HAS BEEN SOME STRUCTURAL EVOLUTION IN THE CENTRAL PORTION OF THE REGION.  A LONG DURATION C1.5 X-RAY FLARE OCCURRED AT 20/0715UT.  THIS FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A STRONG TYPE II RADIO SWEEP AND A CORONAL MASS EJECTION FROM BEYOND THE SOUTHEAST LIMB.  TWO SMALL REGIONS EMERGED SINCE YESTERDAY - 5081 (S21W23) AND 5082 (N26E15).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  A SLIGHT CHANCE OF ENERGETIC ACTIVITY IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5075.  OLD REGION 5060 (S20,L-0002) IS DUE AT THE EAST LIMB ON 22 JULY AND MAY BE THE SOURCE OF THE LDE X-RAY EVENTS OBSERVED ON 19 AND 20 JULY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD AT MIDDLE LATITUDES HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND MOSTLY ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.  INCREASED LEVELS OF ACTIVITY MAY OCCUR LATE ON 22 JULY AND CONTINUE INTO 23 JULY DUE TO TODAY'S LDE X-RAY/CME EVENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  REGION 5075 (S22W52) HAS DECAYED SINCE YESTERDAY, SHOWING SIMPLIFICATION IN THE CENTRAL PORTION OF THE REGION.  THIS REGION CONTINUED TO PRODUCE LOW LEVEL C-CLASS X-RAY ACTIVITY DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.  A LONG DURATION X-RAY FLARE REACHED A MAXIMUM OF C4.5 AT 21/1838UT.  THE SOURCE OF THIS ACTIVITY APPEARS TO BE FROM BEYOND THE SOUTHEAST LIMB.  NEW REGION 5083 (N32E26) EMERGED AS A SMALL UNIPOLAR SPOT GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  THE NEW REGION ROTATING AROUND THE SOUTHEAST LIMB WILL MOST LIKELY INCREASE ACTIVITY LEVELS AS IT APPEARS ON THE SOLAR DISK.  ENERGETIC ACTIVITY IS LESS PROBABLE FROM REGION 5075.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD AT MIDDLE LATITUDES HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO SEVERE STORM LEVELS.  A SUDDEN IMPULSE WAS RECORDED AT MIDDLE LATITUDE STATIONS AT 21/0317UT, FOLLOWING A SLIGHT ENHANCEMENT OF THE 10 MEV PROTON FLUX AT ABOUT 20/2100UT.  THE PROTON FLUX DID NOT CROSS EVENT THRESHOLDS.  THIS ACTIVITY MAY BE THE RESULT OF THE LONG DURATION X-RAY EVENT ON 19 JULY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  REGION 5075 (S22W64) CONTINUED TO DECAY.  THIS REGION REMAINS AT THE SAME ACTIVITY LEVEL, PRODUCING ONLY A FEW SUBFLARES AND C-CLASS X-RAY EVENTS.  THE REGION RESPONSIBLE FOR THE LONG DURATION X-RAY FLARES OF THE PAST FEW DAYS HAS BEEN NUMBERED 5084 (S18E90).  THIS REGION IS JUST BEYOND THE EAST LIMB AND SHOULD COME INTO VIEW WITHIN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.  THE LARGEST FLARE PRODUCED BY THIS REGION DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS WAS A C7.3 AT 22/1124UT.  NEW REGION 5085 (N12E74) APPEARS TO BE THE LEADER SPOTS OF OLD REGION 5062 (N14, L-002).  THIS REGION HAS BEEN QUIET SINCE ITS APPEARANCE ON THE DISK.  NEW REGION 5086 (S31E18) EMERGED AS A SMALL UNIPOLAR SPOT GROUP.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGION 5084 IS THE MOST LIKELY CANDIDATE FOR ENERGETIC ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  REGION 5075 (S21W77) CONTINUES TO DECAY SLOWLY AND IS APPROACHING THE WEST LIMB WITHOUT PRODUCING SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY.  REGION 5084 (S24E66) IS NOW OBSERVED TO BE A SMALL D-TYPE SUNSPOT GROUP.  THIS REGION APEARS TO BE THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5060 (S20, L-002) BUT DOES NOT APPEAR THREATENING NOW THAT IT HAS COME INTO VIEW.  REGION 5084 (N12E63) IS A UNIPOLAR SUNSPOT GROUP COMPRISED OF THE LEADER SUNSPOTS OF OLD REGION 5062 (N14, L-002).  THIS REGION HAS PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES SINCE ITS ARRIVAL ON THE DISK.  NEW REGIONS 5087 (S22W27) AND 5088 (N22W37) EMERGED AS BIPOLAR GROUPS DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.  REGION 5088 IS EMERGING RAPIDLY AND IS ALREADY BEGINNING TO DEVELOP PENUMBRA.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF ISOLATED ENERGETIC ACTIVITY FROM REGIONS 5075, 5084, AND 5085.  SUBFLARES ARE ALSO EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 5085 AND 5088.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD AT MIDDLE LATITUDES HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO ACTIVE LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO STORM LEVELS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND MOSTLY ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE.  REGION 5084 (S24E56) PRODUCED THE LARGEST FLARE OF THE PAST 24 HOURS, AN M2/2N REACHING A MAXIMUM AT 24/0703UT.  THE FLARE WAS LONG DURATION (3.75 HOURS) AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH STRONG TYPE II/IV RADIO EMISSION AND A TENFLARE OF 570 SFU.  SUNSPOT MAGNETIC ANALYSIS INDICATES THAT THE SPOTS IN THIS REGION ARE ALL OF LEADER POLARITY, WHICH SUPPORTS THE VIEW THAT THIS REGION IS DECAYING REMNANTS OF OLD REGION 5060.  REGION 5085 (N12E50) IS ALSO COMPOSED OF ONLY LEADER POLARITY SUNSPOTS.  THIS REGION CONTINUES TO PRODUCE INFREQUENT SUBFLARES AND C-CLASS X-RAY BURSTS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGION 5084 HAS DEMONSTRATED ITS CAPABILITY TO PRODUCE ENERGETIC ACTIVITY AS IT CONTINUES TO DECAY.  ADDITIONAL C-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGIONS 5085 AND 5087 (S23W41).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD AT MIDDLE LATITUDES HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN MOSTLY UNSETTLED.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES.  THIS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED AS A RESULT OF THE LONG DURATION EVENT FROM REGION 5084.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 5084 (S23E44) BEGAN A GROWTH PHASE MIDWAY THROUGH THE PERIOD AND PRODUCED THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE DAY: AN M1/2F FLARE AT 25/2012Z. TWO RAPIDLY EMERGING FLUX REGIONS WERE OBSERVED WITHIN THE GROUP LATE IN THE PERIOD. BRIGHT SURGING AND LOOP PROMINENCE ACTIVITY WERE OBSERVED ON THE SOUTHWEST LIMB NEAR S22. THIS ACTIVITY PROBABLY ORIGINATED WITHIN OLD REGION 5075, NOW WELL PAST THE WEST LIMB. TWO WEST LIMB CORONAL MASS EJECTIONS WERE OBSERVED DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD. THE FIRST WAS OBSERVED AT 25/0820Z AND THE SECOND AT 25/0953Z. A LARGE FILAMENT DISAPPEARED DURING THE PERIOD. IT EXTENDED FROM (ROUGHLY) N49E10 TO N55W65 BEFORE IT'S DISAPPEARANCE. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: REGION 5089 (N21E12) AND 5090 (N13E47). BOTH WERE SIMPLE UNIPOLES.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. THERE IS A GOOD CHANCE OF M-LEVEL AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF X-LEVEL FLARING FROM REGION 5084.

sections.text: THE MIDDLE LATITUDE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD WAS AT MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LEVELS AND AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES IN RESPONSE TO YESTERDAY'S LONG-DURATION M2/2N FLARE FROM REGION 5084.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5084 (S22E18) PRODUCED SEVERAL C-CLASS FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. THE LARGEST WAS A C8/2N AT 27/0746Z ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. FRAGMENTATION OF THE TRAILER PENUMBRA WAS REPORTED TODAY WHICH MAY INDICATE THAT THE REGION IS BEGINNING A PERIOD OF SLOW DECAY. STRONG CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 5084 AND 5092 (N26E70). REGION 5092, ORIGINALLY CLASSED AS AN H-TYPE SPOT, CONTINUED TO ROTATE INTO VIEW TODAY AND IS NOW CLASSIFIED AS AN E-TYPE GROUP. A LARGE FILAMENT DISAPPEARED DURING THE PERIOD. ITS CENTROID WAS NEAR S38W16 WHEN LAST OBSERVED. THREE NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 5093 (N26W48), 5094 (S22E10), AND 5095 (N32E81).

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. M-CLASS FLARES ARE LIKELY FROM REGION 5084. THERE IS ALSO A SLIGHT CHANCE OF AN X-CLASS FLARE FROM THIS REGION.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 26/2100Z TO 27/2100Z:
sections.text: THE MIDDLE LATITUDE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED LEVELS DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS RANGED FROM UNSETTLED TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND AT MINOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 27/2100Z
sections.text: TO 28/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. THE LARGEST EVENT OF THE PERIOD WAS AN UNCORRELATED C8 X-RAY BURST AT 28/0252Z. MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS ACCOMPANIED THE EVENT. REGION 5084 (S20E05) CONTINUED TO SLOWLY DECAY, BUT HAS RETAINED A DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION WITHIN ITS TRAILER SPOTS. IT PRODUCED A C7/SN FLARE AT 28/1212Z. REGIONS 5092 (N27E56) AND 5095 (N30E66) EACH PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD AND MAY BE INTERACTING. THESE REGIONS HAVE BEEN THE SOURCE OF STRONG CALCIUM XV EMISSIONS. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE OF M-CLASS ACTIVITY FROM REGION 5084. REGIONS 5092 AND 5095 PROVIDE A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD WAS GENERALLY ACTIVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO THE LARGE FILAMENTS THAT ERUPTED ON 25 AND 27 JULY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 28/2100Z
sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. AFTER A DETAILED MAGNETIC FIELD ANALYSIS, REGION 5095 (N30E66 AT 29/0000Z) WAS DETERMINED TO BE AN EXTENSION OF REGION 5092 (N29E48) RATHER THAN A SEPARATE GROUP. THE REGION PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 5084 (S22W08) ALSO PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES WHILE CONTINUING TO GRADUALLY DECAY. REGION 5090 (N16W03) BEGAN A PERIOD OF GRADUAL GROWTH DURING THE LATTER HALF OF THE PERIOD AND HAS PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES. NEW REGION 5096 (N26E26) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY. IT IS A SIMPLE BIPOLE IN A SLOW GROWTH PHASE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 5092 PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR M-CLASS FLARING. THERE IS A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY FROM REGION 5084.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE THROUGH THE PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO THE LARGE FILAMENTS THAT ERUPTED ON 25 AND 27 JULY.

THE GROWTH IN THIS REGION CEASED BUT SOME MIXED POLARITIES ARE EVIDENT. REGION 5084 (S21W19) PRODUCED SEVERAL CLASS C SUBFLARES AND A WEAK DELTA FORMED IN THIS SLOWLY DECAYING REGION.

sections.text: SHOULD BE ACTIVE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. THIS FORECAST IS BASED IN PART UPON A LARGE FILAMENT DISRUPTION OBSERVED ON 27 JULY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5092 (N27E24) PRODUCED AN M4/1B AT 31/0732Z WITH MINOR RADIO BURSTS. A SMALL DELTA FORMED IN THE TRAILER OF REGION 5092 WHICH WAS THE SITE OF MOST OF THE FLARES DURING THE PERIOD. A WEAK DELTA REMAINS IN REGION 5084 (S22W31) BUT IS DECAYING. REGION 5090 (N15W29) GREW RAPIDLY DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS BUT PRODUCED LITTLE IN THE WAY OF X-RAY BURSTS. A SMALL REGION EMERGED AT S25E40 AND WAS NUMBERED AS REGION 5097.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: AT A MODERATE LEVEL. REGION 5092 SHOULD REMAIN THE MOST PROLIFIC FLARE PRODUCING REGION. AN ISOLATED CLASS M FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5084. SHOULD REGION 5090 CONTINUE TO EMERGE STRONGLY, SMALL CLASS M FLARES COULD RESULT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE MID LATITUDE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED. GEOMAGNETIC CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES WERE PREDOMINANTLY ACTIVE, WITH BRIEF PERIODS AT BOTH UNSETTLED AND MINOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: AT BOTH MID AND HIGH LATITUDES SHOULD BE GENERALLY ACTIVE FOR THE PERIOD. HIGH LATITUDES SHOULD CONTINUE TO EXPERIENCE SHORT PERIODS AT MINOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE. REGION 5092 (N28E11) PRODUCED AN M2/1B FLARE AT 01/0632 UT THAT WAS ACCOM- PANIED BY A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP AND OPTICAL PARALLEL RIBBONS. FLARE DURATION EXCEEDED 90 MINUTES.  REGION 5092 REMAINED MOSTLY STABLE IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA, BUT HAS SIMPLIFIED IN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY.  THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK WAS GENERALLY STABLE ALTHOUGH THE 10.7 CM FLUX DECREASED SIGNIFI- CANTLY FROM YESTERDAY'S VALUE.  A FILAMENT LOCATED BETWEEN S17W01 AND S06W08 ON JULY 31/1452 UT HAD DISAPPEARED BY 1302 UT TODAY.  NO LIMB ACTIVITY WAS REPORTED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE.  REGION 5092 IS EXPECTED TO PRODUCE ADDITIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY, WITH A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED SIGNIFICANT FLARES FROM 5084 (S21W43) AND 5090 (N14W42).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD AT MIDDLE LATITUDES HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  PERIODS AT ACTIVE LEVELS WERE OBSERVED AT HIGH GEOMAGNETIC LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINATELY QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS, WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS ON THE THIRD DAY IN RESPONSE TO THE LONG DURATION FLARE AND FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE TODAY. AT HIGH GEOMAGNETIC LATITUDES, GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE.  REGION 5092 (N28W01) PRODUCED AN M1/1B EVENT THAT MAXED AT 1724 UT. IT WAS A COMPACT FLARE, ASSOCIATED WITH AN IMPRESSIVE DARK SURGE ON THE DISK AND A MAJOR TYPE II RADIO SWEEP.  REGION 5092 HAS SIMPLI- FIED SOMEWHAT TODAY BUT REMAINS A THREAT FOR FURTHER ACTIVITY. FIVE OF THE SIX SPOTTED REGIONS ON THE DISK PRODUCED SUBFLARE ACTIVITY. NONE OF THE REGIONS SHOWED DRAMATIC GROWTH OR DECAY. SEVERAL SEGMENTS OF A LONG INVERSION LINE FILAMENT NEAR S25E10 DISAPPEARED BETWEEN 01/1512 AND 02/0037. SURGING WAS REPORTED ON THE EAST LIMB NEAR N22 AND N31.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE.  REGION 5092 RETAINS THE POTENTIAL FOR CONTINUED SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY, WITH A SLIGHT POTENTIAL FOR MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT MOSTLY QUIET LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. AT HIGH LATITUDES, THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS PREDOMINATELY UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED TOMORROW, BUT COULD BECOME UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE ON THE NEXT DAY DUE TO SOLAR EVENTS (FLARE AND FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE) ON 1 AUGUST. THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD SHOULD RETURN TO GENERALLY QUIET LEVELS BY THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD AT HIGH LATITUDES IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN GENERALLY ACTIVE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.  THE LARGEST EVENTS WERE AN UNASSOCIATED M1 THAT MAXED AT 1034 UT, AND AN M1 SUBFLARE FROM REGION 5090 (N15W69) THAT MAXED AT 2035 UT. ELEVEN C-CLASS EVENTS OCCURRED, PRIMARILY FROM REGION 5090 WHERE A WEAK DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIG- URATION HAS DEVELOPED. THREE NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED. REGION 5098 (S19W29) EMERGED ON THE DISK AS A B-TYPE GROUP BUT IS ALREADY DECAYING. REGION 5099 (N22E83) ROTATED OVER THE EAST LIMB AND IS PRESENTLY SEEN AS AN H-TYPE SPOT.  5099 IS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5071 WHICH PRODUCED C-CLASS ACTIVITY LAST ROTATION. REGION 5100 (N29E89) ALSO ROTATED OVER THE LIMB AS AN H-TYPE SPOT.  IT IS THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5073 WHICH PRODUCED M-CLASS ACTIVITY LAST ROTATION. SURGING ON THE EAST LIMB HAS BEEN REPORTED WITH BOTH 5099 AND 5100.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5092 HAS PROVEN POTENTIAL FOR M-CLASS FLARES, BUT THERE IS AN INCREASED CHANCE OF SIGNIFICANT FLARES FROM REGION 5090.  THERE IS A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF MAJOR (X-CLASS) FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET to unsettled levels at middle AND HIGH latitudes FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE TOMORROW DUE TO SOLAR EVENTS (FLARE AND FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCE) ON 1 AUGUST.  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD SHOULD RETURN TO GENERALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE FOLLOWING TWO DAYS.  AT HIGH LATITUDES, THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS EXPECTED TO REMAIN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 07/2100Z
sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5092 (N27W75) PRODUCED AN M1/SF AT 08/0810Z WITH NO ASSOCIATED RADIO BURSTS. REGION 5101 (S14W40) CONTINUED TO EMERGE RAPIDLY AND HAS BEEN REMARKABLE IN ITS TOTAL LACK OF FLARE PRODUCTION. REGION 5099 (N22E17) DOUBLED IN SIZE DURING THE PERIOD AND BEGAN TO PRODUCE CLASS C FLARES. A LARGE FILAMENT, WHICH AT THIS TIME WOULD HAVE BEEN LOCATED BETWEEN S38W39-S25W65, ERUPTED NEAR 08/1018Z. A SLOW CORONAL MASS EJECTION WAS OBSERVED BY THE SOLAR MAXIMUM MISSION AT THAT TIME IN THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT OF THE FIELD OF VIEW OF THE CORONAGRAPH. REGIONS 5107 (N32E53) AND 5108 (S20E68) WERE NUMBERED TODAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD CONTINUE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGIONS 5092, 5101, 5099, AND 5105 APPEAR CAPABLE OF PRODUCING ISOLATED CLASS M FLARES. NO SIGNIFICANT ACTIVE REGIONS ARE EXPECTED TO RETURN DURING THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 07/2100Z TO 08/2100Z:
sections.text: THE MID LATITUDE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. AT HIGH LATITUDES, THE FIELD WAS PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED WITH BRIEF PERIODS AT ACTIVE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE MID LATITUDE FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD REMAIN QUIET TO SLIGHTLY UNSETTLED. HIGH LATITUDE CONDITIONS SHOULD BE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED. THE LARGE FILAMENT WHICH ERUPTED TODAY IS NOT EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE EARTH.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. ONLY SMALL FLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD: THOSE WITH OPTICAL CORRELATIONS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH REGIONS 5106 (N22E49), 5101 (S14W54), AND 5099 (N23E02). REGION 5099 GREW DURING THE DAY AND APPEARS TO HAVE FORMED A WEAK DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE TRAILING PART OF THE GROUP. REGION 5092 (N29W86) PRODUCED SURGE ACTIVITY ON THE WEST LIMB AND IS QUIETLY EXITING THE SOLAR DISK. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.text: GENERALLY LOW WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY FROM REGIONS 5099 AND 5101.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES. SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES REPORTED STORM LEVEL ACTIVITY AT THE END OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES TOMORROW. INCREASINGLY ACTIVE LEVELS AT ALL LATITUDES ARE EXPECTED ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS FROM EFFECTS OF THE FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED ON 08 AUGUST.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. SEVERAL C-CLASS X-RAY FLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD WITH CONTRIBUTIONS FROM REGIONS 5099 (N23W12), 5101 (S14W68), 5105 (N16E33), AND 5106 (N22E36). THE WEAK DELTA PREVIOUSLY OBSERVED IN REGION 5099 IS NO LONGER PRESENT. STACKED REGIONS 5105 AND 5106 NEARLY DOUBLED IN SIZE SINCE YESTERDAY. REGION 5092 (N29) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE SURGE ACTIVITY ON THE WEST LIMB AS IT ROTATED OUT OF VIEW. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: BE GENERALLY LOW WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS. THE CONFIGURATION AND GROWTH OF REGIONS 5105 AND 5106 COULD BE A MECHANISM FOR BUILDING UP MAGNETIC SHEAR. OTHER POSSIBLE SOURCES OF ENERGETIC ACTIVITY INCLUDE REGION 5101 WHICH APPEARS TO HAVE SOME NEW FLUX EMERGING, AND REGION 5099 WHICH CONTINUES TO BE SOMEWHAT COMPLICATED MAGNETICALLY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES. A BRIEF PERIOD OF ENCHANCED ACTIVE CONDITIONS OCCURRED EARLY IN THE DAY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/0130Z WITH REPORTS OF STORM LEVEL ACTIVITY AT SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY ACTIVE ON 11-12 AUGUST IN RESPONSE TO THE FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED ON 08 AUGUST. CONDITIONS SHOULD DIMINISH ON THE THIRD DAY TO PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS WITH PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN VERY LOW. REGION 5118 (S23W21) PRODUCED A SUBFAINT FLARE AT 21/2100Z WITH NO ASSOCIATED X-RAY OR RADIO EMISSIONS. THE REMAINING REGIONS WERE QUIET AND STABLE THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD. WEAK SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON THE EAST LIMB NEAR N30. A SLOW CORONAL MASS EJECTION WAS OBSERVED FROM THE SOUTHEAST LIMB AT 22/0156Z. NEW REGION 5122 (N17E34) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY. IT WAS FORMERLY THE TRAILER SPOT OF REGION 5115 (N14E24). NEW REGION 5123 (N22E74) EMERGED AS A SMALL UNIPOLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF C-CLASS FLARING FROM REGIONS 5115 AND 5122.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING BEGAN EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 54 NANOTESLAS RECORDED AT BOULDER AT 21/2230Z. MINOR TO MAJOR STORMING CONTINUED THROUGH 22/0900Z. THEREAFTER, THE FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED. THE STORMING MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY SEVERAL FILAMENT DISAPPEARANCES WHICH OCCURRED ON 17-18 AUGUST.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO QUIET AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES BASED ON THE RECURRENT PATTERN OF ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE. AN M2 LONG DURATION X-RAY EVENT OCCURRED AT 23/1804Z IN CONJUNCTION WITH AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE ON THE NORTHEAST LIMB NEAR N20. A TYPE II RADIO SWEEP BURST, GRADUAL RISE/FALL RADIO EVENT, AND A LOOP PROMINENECE SYSTEM WERE ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH THE ERUPTION. REGION 5122 (N16E19) PRODUCED A C7/1F FLARE AT 23/0936Z. MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FLARE. TWO CORONAL MASS EJECTIONS WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD. THE FIRST OCCURRED AT 23/0851Z, LEAVING THE SOUTHEAST LIMB WITH MODERATE VELOCITY. THE SECOND CME LEFT THE NORTHEAST LIMB AT 23/1342Z WITH MODERATE VELOCITY. NEW REGION 5124 (S37E21) WAS ASSIGNED TODAY. IT EMERGED AS A SMALL BIPOLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE FOR MORE M-CLASS ACTIVITY FROM THE NORTHEAST LIMB. ISOLATED C-CLASS FLARES ARE EXPECTED FROM REGION 5122.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MIDDLE LATITUDES WHILE THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S NORTHEAST LIMB ACTIVITY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5125 (N28E67) DID NOT PRODUCE ANY SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY. IT WAS THE PROBABLE SOURCE OF A 23 AUG M2 LONG DURATION X-RAY EVENT (LDXE) WITH ASSOCIATED CORONAL MASS EJECTION (CME) THAT WAS SEEN OVER THE EASTNORTHEAST LIMB AS AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE AND THEN LOOPS. LITTLE PLAGE OR OTHER CHARACTERISTICALLY SIGNIFICANT FEATURES REMAIN, BUT THE FILAMENT OR NEUTRAL LINE CHANNEL CAN BE SEEN, IN AN ACUTELY BENT CONFIGURATION, AT AN OPENING OR BREAK IN THE DARK FILAMENT. ALL ASPECTS AND PARAMETERS IN THE REGION ARE NOW AVERAGE, AND THE POTENTIAL CONSIDERABLY LESS THAN BEFORE THE PROBABLE HYDER-FLARE THREE DAYS AGO AT 23/1804Z. REGION 5117 (N19W31) RESURGED WITH SUBFLARE ACTIVITY AS A BETA-GAMMA TYPE. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5127 (N21W41) EMERGED JUST AHEAD OF REGION 5117. THE BIGGEST NEW REGION IS 5126 (S22E64). THIS 510 MILS EKO TYPE IS COMPLICATED OR TWO REGIONS INTERTWINED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 5126 PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE OF HIGH ACTIVITY, AND A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE. REGION 5125 STILL MAY RETAIN THE POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY, BUT INITIAL OBSERVATIONS INDICATE OTHERWISE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY ACTIVE. MINOR STORM PERIODS OCCURRED LATE IN THE PERIOD AT HIGH LATITUDES. A SLIGHT LOW ENERGY PROTON ENHANCEMENT STARTED AT 24/0400Z AND CONTINUES BELOW THE EVENT THRESHOLD LEVEL. THIS WAS PROBABLY THE RESULT OF THE LDXE OF 23/1804Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS IN RESPONSE TO THE LDXE WITH CORRELATED CME OF 23/1804Z. THIS DISTURBANCE SHOULD PEAK THE FIRST DAY AND THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO RECOVER TO RECURRENTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS BY THE LAST DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 27/2100Z TO 28/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED. THE LOW ENERGY PROTON VALUES WERE ENHANCED THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE PERIOD. THE OVERALL APPEARANCE OF THE LAST TWO DAYS' FLUCTUATIONS IS NOT THAT OF A PROTON EVENT, BUT RATHER MORE AN ACCUMMULATIVE INCREASE FROM MORE THAN A SINGLE SOURCE. FREQUENT, VERY SHORT TERM INTERVALS OF VALUES JUST AT AND ABOVE THE EVENT LEVEL THRESHOLD WERE OBSERVED BOTH YESTERDAY AND TODAY. THESE SEVEN BRIEF INTERVALS VARIED FROM 15 TO 90 MINUTES IN DURATION AND NEVER EXCEEDED 14 P/SQ.CM-S-SR IN INTENSITY AT THE 10 MEV ENERGY LEVEL. THE ENHANCEMENT APPEARS TO HAVE ENDED.

sections.text: TO 29/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW.  REGION 5131 (S19E47) IS THE MOST IMPRESSIVE AND PRODUCTIVE REGION ON THE DISK.  IT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 30 SPOTS, BRIGHT PLAGE, AND EMBEDDED FILAMENTS.  MAGNETICALLY IT WARRANTS THE COMPLEX BETA-GAMMA DELTA CLASSIFICATION.  THE DAY'S LARGEST EVENT, A C9/1N - MAX AT 1553Z - WAS AMONG THE FIVE FLARES GENERATED BY THE REGION DURING THE PERIOD. OTHER NOTEWORTHY REGIONS ARE 5126 (S23E18) AND 5128 (N21E23).  BOTH OF THESE HAVE BEEN DYNAMIC DURING THE INTERVAL.  WEAK SURGING HAS BEEN REPORTED AT WEST LIMB NEAR N20 WHERE REGION 5127 IS NOW POSITIONED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 31/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUES LOW. REGION 5128 (N22W03) ASSUMED THE ROLE OF THE LEADING FLARE PRODUCER.  IT GENERATED OCCASIONAL C-CLASS ACTIVITY, THE LARGEST A C4/1F AT 0511Z.  THE REGION HAS GROWN SUBSTANTIALLY IN WHITE LIGHT AND H-ALPHA. REGION 5131 (S19E21) REMAINS COMPLEX AND OMINOUS BUT HAS BEEN MOSTLY QUIET DURING THE PERIOD.  NO NEW REGION WAS ASSIGNED. THERE IS AN AREA OF EMERGING FLUX NEAR N25E75, HOWEVER, WHERE POSSIBLY TWO SMALL BIPOLES ARE ROTATING INTO VIEW. SURGING OCCURRED NEAR N15W90 WHERE REGION 5115 IS NOW LOCATED.  THERE WAS A REPORT OF A RADIO BURST AT 2695 MHZ OF 230 F.U. AT 1642Z. THAT BURST HAD NO X-RAY OR OPTICAL COUNTERPART AND MAY HAVE BEEN AFFECTED BY INTERFERENCE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY MAY OCCUR IN EITHER REGION 5131 OR 5128.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 30/2100Z TO 31/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MID- LATITUDES.  HIGH LATITUDES OBSERVED GENERALLY ACTIVE CONDITIONS WITH INTERVALS OF MINOR STORM LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE WITH ISOLATED MINOR STORM CONDITIONS FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY PERSISTS AT LOW LEVELS. PERIODIC C-CLASS SUBFLARES OCCURRED IN REGIONS 5128 (N22W16) AND 5131 (S20E08). THE DAY'S MOST ENERGETIC EVENT WAS A C6/0B FROM REGION 5131 AT 2054Z. ANOTHER FLARE OF NOTE WAS A C3/0F WITH ASSOCIATED TYPE II - SHOCK SPEED ESTIMATES RANGED FROM 1000 TO 1600 K/S - FROM REGION 5128 AT 1849Z. ALL SPOTTED REGIONS COULD BE CHARACTERIZED AS STABLE DURING THE PERIOD. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5133 (N26E59) IS SMALL AND SIMPLE. THE LIMBS WERE QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. ISOLATED M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS STILL A DISTINCT POSSIBILITY FROM REGIONS 5128 AND 5131.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 31/2100Z TO 01/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT MID- LATITUDES. HIGH LATITUDES WERE AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS MUCH OF THE DAY.  THE DISTURBANCE WAS MOST SEVERE DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME HOURS IN EACH CASE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.  SUBSTORM ACTIVITY IS LIKELY TO CONTINUE DURING NIGHTTIME HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  REGION 5131 (S20W06) PRODUCED BUT A FEW C-CLASS FLARES, THE LARGEST A C3/0F AT 0803Z. NO OTHER FLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD. THE DISK ITSELF WAS IN A GENERAL STATE OF DECAY AS EVIDENCED BY A 13 FLUX UNIT DECREASE FROM YESTERDAY IN THE OTTAWA 10 CM. FLUX. THE WHOLE SUN BACKGROUND X-RAY FLUX WAS DOWN AS WELL. NO NEW REGION WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW.  OCCASIONAL C-CLASS ACTIVITY MAY STEM FROM REGION 5131 AND REGION 5128 (N22W29). M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS UNLIKELY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 01/2100Z TO 02/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN GENERALLY UNSETTLED AT MID- LATITUDES.  HIGH LATITUDE SITES OBSERVED ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS WITH AN INTERVAL OF MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS AROUND 0730Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD BE GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.  EXPECT SHORT-LIVED SUBSTORMS TO OCCUR DURING LOCAL NIGHTTIME HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 02/2100Z
sections.text: TO 03/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5131 (S21W18) CONTINUED TO PRODUCE SMALL C-CLASS SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD AND CONTINUES TO BE THE LARGEST, MOST IMPRESSIVE GROUP ON THE DISK AT THIS TIME. REGION 5126 (S22W51) ALSO PRODUCED A FEW SMALL C-CLASS SUBFLARES INCLUDING TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT, A C5.8/1N AT 0719Z. TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: REGION 5134 (N33E75), A SIMPLE H-TYPE SPOT THAT ROTATED INTO VIEW,  AND REGION 5135 (N19E07) A SIMPLE B-TYPE GROUP THAT EMERGED ON THE DISK. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY FROM REGION 5131.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 02/2100Z TO 03/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MID-LATITUDES AND WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES. A BRIEF PERIOD OF MINOR STORM LEVELS WAS REPORTED BY SOME HIGH LATITUDE SITES EARLY IN THE DAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND MOSTLY ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 03/2100Z
sections.text: TO 04/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. ONLY SMALL C-CLASS SUBFLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD, AND MOST OF THESE WERE PRODUCED BY REGION 5131 (S20W31) WHICH CONTINUES TO BE THE MOST IMPRESSIVE REGION ON THE DISK. FOUR NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: REGION 5136 (N16W27), AN EMERGING SIMPLE BI-POLAR GROUP, REGION 5137 (S20E75) WHICH ROTATED INTO VIEW AS A BI-POLAR C-TYPE GROUP, REGION 5138 (N13E56) A SMALL A-TYPE SPOT, AND REGION 5139 (N35E70) A SIMPLE B-TYPE BI-POLAR GROUP. AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE WAS OBSERVED AT ABOUT S20 ON THE EAST LIMB AND EXTENDED OUT TO .06 SOLAR RADII. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE STABLE OR DECLINING.

sections.text: GENERALLY LOW. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS FROM REGION 5131.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 04/2100Z
sections.text: TO 05/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5131 (S20W44) PRODUCED A FEW C-CLASS FLARES TODAY, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C4/1F AT 1835Z. THE REGION STARTED TO DECAY NEAR THE END OF THE PERIOD. REGION 5126 (S21W80) PRODUCED SURGE ACTIVITY AS IT APPROACHED THE WEST LIMB. REGION 5137 (S20E62) ALSO PRODUCED SURGE ACTIVITY ON THE EAST LIMB. FURTHER ANALYSIS OF REGIONS 5139 AND 5134 INDICATED THAT THESE SPOTS CONSTITUTE A SINGLE REGION: THE ENTIRE GROUP IS NOW LABELED REGION 5134 (N34E54). THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.text: LOW. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS FROM REGION 5131.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. ONLY A FEW C-CLASS SUBFLARES WERE OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD AND ALL OF THOSE WHICH WERE OBSERVED OPTICALLY WERE PRODUCED BY REGION 5131 (S22W57). REGION 5126 (S21 WEST LIMB) PRODUCED SURGE ACTIVITY AS IT ROTATED OUT OF VIEW. ADDITIONAL SURGING WAS REPORTED ON THE EAST LIMB AT ABOUT N33. TWO NEW REGIONS EMERGED ON THE DISK TODAY: REGION 5140 (S27W21) AND REGION 5141 (N19W12). BOTH WERE SMALL A-TYPE SUNSPOT GROUPS. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE STABLE OR DECLINING.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: VERY LOW TO LOW. REGION 5131 WILL BE ROTATING OUT OF VIEW ON 09 SEPTEMBER AND IT IS EXPECTED THE SOLAR ACTIVITY AND FLUX LEVELS WILL DECLINE NOTICEABLY AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. AT HIGH LATITUDES THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET UNTIL LATE IN THE PERIOD WHEN CONDITIONS BECAME MOSTLY UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES ON THE FIRST DAY. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE GRADUALLY TO UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS DUE TO RECURRENT EFFECTS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 06/2100Z
sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. ONLY SMALL C-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED. THOSE WITH OPTICAL CORRELATIONS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 5131 (S21W70). SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 5126 (S25), REGION 5128 (N20) AND REGION 5129 (S13). A NEW REGION, ASSOCIATED WITH YESTERDAY'S EAST LIMB SURGE ACTIVITY, ROTATED INTO VIEW AT N32E80 AS A SIMPLE BIPOLAR GROUP AND WAS ASSIGNED SESC REGION NUMBER 5142. REGION 5136 (N16W69) RE-EMERGED WITH SPOTS AND DEVELOPED PENUMBRA ON LEADER AND FOLLOWER SPOTS BUT WAS NOT OBSERVED TO PRODUCE ANY ACTIVITY. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO VERY LOW. REGION 5131 WILL START TO EXIT THE DISK LATE TOMORROW AND IT IS EXPECTED THAT SOLAR ACTIVITY AND FLUX LEVELS WILL DECLINE NOTICEABLY AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 06/2100Z TO 07/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE NEXT TWO DAYS. THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS ON THE THIRD DAY AS A CORONAL HOLE WILL BE MOVING INTO A FAVORABLE POSITION AT THAT TIME.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW TO MODERATE.  REGION 5131 (S23W85) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS X-RAY FLARES DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS, AN M2/1N AT 08/1241Z AND AN M1/SN AT 08/1847Z. sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  ANOTHER ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE IS POSSIBLE FROM REGION 5131 AS IT ROTATES AROUND THE WEST LIMB.  CORONAL DATA SUGGESTS THAT THERE MAY BE A LARGE ACTIVE REGION NEARING THE SOUTHEAST LIMB.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE FIRST DAY OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.  ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO BEGIN ON THE SECOND DAY DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.
