sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. RADIATIONS FROM REGION 5163 (N22E59) AND THE EASTNORTHEAST NEAR-LIMB AREA NEXT TO IT PROVIDED MUCH OF THE ENHANCED X-RAY AND 10.7CM FLUX BACKGROUNDS. TWO NEW REGIONS EMERGED NEAR THE CENTER OF THE DISK - REGIONS 5164 (N19W23) AND 5165 (N20W11). A LARGE CME OCCURRED AT 210020Z FROM THE WESTNORTHWEST LIMB. AN ESTIMATED 35DEGREE LONG FILAMENT DISAPPEARED SOMETIME DURING THE PERIOD FROM THE NORTHNORTHWEST QUADRANT. ITS APPROXIMATE CENTROID POINT WAS N52W15.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 5163 AND THE CLOSE AREA TO THE LIMB PROVIDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF MODERATE ACTIVITY. THE ENHANCED BACKGROUND SHOULD STAY ELEVATED THROUGHTOUT THIS GROUPS' TOUR OF THE DISK. THEY ALSO PROVIDE A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF BOTH HIGH ACTIVITY AND/OR PROTON PRODUCING FLARES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO QUIET.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY ACTIVE. MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED AT HIGH LATITUDES. THIS DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED DUE TO FLARES AND A WEAK CORONAL HOLE NEAR THE EQUATOR.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 21/2100Z
sections.text: TO 22/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5159 (N27E29) PRODUCED AN M2/0F FLARE WITH MINOR RADIO BURSTS AT 220808Z. THIS REGION WITH ITS IMMEDIATE ADJACENT AREA TOWARDS THE EAST LIMB PROVIDED MOST OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITY. A CME OCCURRED AT 220212Z FROM THE NORTHEAST LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. REGION 5159 AND THAT NORTHEAST SECTOR'S GROUPS PROVIDE A SLIGHT TO FAIR CHANCE OF MODERATE ACTIVITY. THEY ALSO PROVIDE A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF HIGH ACTIVITY AND/OR PROTON PRODUCING FLARES. THE ENHANCED BACKGROUND SHOULD NOW STAY ELEVATED FOR THEIR TRANSIENT OF THE DISK.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 21/2100Z TO 22/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. MAJOR STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED AT HIGH LATITUDES, AND A MINOR STORM CONDITION OCCURRED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES LATE IN THE PERIOD. THIS DISTURBANCE MAY BE THE RESULT OF FLARES AND AN ISOLATED WEAK CORONAL HOLE NEAR THE EQUATOR.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM TO ACTIVE LEVELS THE FIRST DAY, AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE ENDS. THE LAST TWO DAYS ARE EXPECTED TO BE AT OR ABOVE ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS IN RESPONSE TO THE 32 DEGREE LONG FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED FROM THE DISK, NEAR N48W09 BEFORE 21/1431Z SEP. THIS EVENT MAY HAVE BEEN ASSOCIATED WITH A LARGE CME FROM THE WESTNORTHWEST LIMB AT 210020Z.

sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW.  FREQUENT C-CLASS FLARE ACTIVITY OCCURRED IN A NUMBER OF THE 14 SPOTTED REGIONS NOW ON THE DISK. sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  THE X-RAY BACKGROUND IS HOVERING NEAR C-LEVEL AND THAT FACT, ALONG WITH THE NUMEROUS ACTIVE REGIONS ON THE DISK, MAKES M-CLASS ACTIVITY DISTINCTLY POSSIBLE.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MID- LATITUDES.  ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS PREVAILED AT HIGH LATITUDE SITES.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. SHORT-LIVED PERIODS OF ENHANCED ACTIVITY ARE POSSIBLE BOTH EARLY (DUE TO FILAMENT-RELATED ACTIVITY) AND LATE (DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS) IN THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 30/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE. REGION 5171 (S25E21) PRODUCED AN M1.7/2N FLARE THAT BEGAN AT 1859Z, REACHED MAXIMUM AT 1922Z AND ENDED AT 2021Z. THE EVENT WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A TYPE II SWEEP WITH ESTIMATED SHOCK VELOCITY OF 1700 KM/S AND A SUBSEQUENT TYPE IV SWEEP. THE REGION WAS A BETA-GAMMA- DELTA MAGNETIC CLASS FOR THE EARLY PART OF THE DAY BUT MORE RECENT REPORTS INDICATE THAT THE REGION HAS EVOLVED TO A SIMPLER, BETA TYPE CLASSIFICATION. REGION 5168 (N19W16) PRODUCED A C6.0/SF AT 0108Z BUT WAS OTHERWISE FAIRLY STABLE. SIGNIFICANT SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON THE EAST LIMB AT ABOUT S16 AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH ENHANCED CORONAL YELLOW LINE EMISSION. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 30/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE. A M1.8/1N FLARE WITH AN ASSOCIATED TYPE II RADIO SWEEP WAS OBSERVED AT 0729Z AND WAS OPTICALLY CORRELATED WITH REGION 5162 (N22W88), A SMALL, UNIMPRESSIVE SUNSPOT GROUP. AN UNASSOCIATED C9.4 FLARE OCCURRED AT 0122Z. THE MAJORITY OF THE REST OF THE FLARES WERE PRODUCED BY REGION 5171 (S25E07), THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C5.4/1N AT 1938Z. THIS REGION EVIDENCED A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION ALTHOUGH SOME DECAY IN THE LARGE LEADER DELTA SPOT WAS OBSERVED DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 5168 (N20W31) GREW DURING THE PERIOD BUT WAS OBSERVED TO PRODUCE ONLY ONE SUBFLARE. NEW REGION 5175 (S15E72) ROTATED INTO VIEW AS A MATURE DKO GROUP. IN ADDITION, TWO SMALL REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED DURING THE PERIOD: REGION 5174 (N17W23), AND REGION 5176 (N28W63). SURGING WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB ASSOCIATED WITH REGIONS 5159 (N28W89) AND 5162 (N22W88), AND ON THE EAST LIMB ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 5175. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. REGIONS 5168 AND 5171 POSE THE MAIN THREAT FOR CONTINUED ENERGETIC FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BECOME ACTIVE TOMORROW AND PARTWAY THROUGH THE SECOND DAY WITH PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING AT HIGH LATITUDES. THIS INCREASE IS FORECAST BECAUSE OF THE ENERGETIC FLARE ACTIVITY THAT HAS OCCURRED OVER THE LAST FEW DAYS. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO SUBSIDE TO QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS AT MID- LATITUDES AND TO GENERALLY ACTIVE LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES BY THE THIRD DAY.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. THE MAJORITY OF FLARE ACTIVITY CONTINUES TO BE PRODUCED BY REGION 5171 (S25W06): THE GROUP PRODUCED SEVERAL FLARES, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C9.4 SUBFAINT AT 0427Z. REGION 5174 (N17W36) ALSO CONTRIBUTED SEVERAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES AS IT GREW AND DEVELOPED SPOTS DURING THE PERIOD. REGION 5175 (S15E61) ROTATED MORE CLEARLY INTO VIEW AND IS NOW THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK (AREA OF 580). THE GROUP PRODUCED A C2.3 SUBFLARE AT 0642Z. NEW REGION 5177 (N24E84) ROTATED INTO VIEW WITH ASSOCIATED LIMB SURGE ACTIVITY AS A SINGLE H-TYPE SPOT. SURGING WAS ALSO OBSERVED ON THE NORTHWEST LIMB AS REGIONS 5159 AND 5162 EXITED THE SOLAR DISK. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: AT LOW TO MODERATE LEVELS. REGION 5171 IS THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR PRODUCTION OF ENERGETIC EVENTS GIVEN ITS CONTINUED STRENGTH AND MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION. THERE IS ALSO A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SUCH FLARES FROM EACH OF 5168, 5174, AND 5175 SINCE THESE ARE ALL MATURE GROUPS WITH SOME DYNAMIC CHARACTERISTICS. BECAUSE OF THE COMBINED FLARE PROBABILITIES FROM THESE REGIONS THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A MAJOR FLARE (GREATER THAN M5) WHICH COULD PRODUCE ENERGETIC PROTON ENHANCEMENTS.

sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5171 (S26W100) PRODUCED A C4/1F AT 08/2200Z. sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN HIGH. REGION 5175 (S16W73) PRODUCED AN X2/2N FLARE AT 12/0511Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A 490 SFU DISCRETE FREQUENCY BURST AT 2695 MHZ (AS WELL AS OTHER BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM), AN ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE AND BRIGHT SURGE NEAR THE LIMB, AND A TYPE IV SWEEP FREQUENCY BURST. THE REGION ALSO PRODUCED AN M1 X-RAY BURST AT 12/1212Z. NO SIGNIFICANT RADIO EMMISSIONS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE EVENT. LITTLE OR NO ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED FROM THE OTHER REGIONS. FOUR NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 5189 (N25E35), 5190 (S20E13), 5191 (S23E28), AND 5192 (N19E58). REGION 5192 WAS FORMERLY THE TRAILER PORTION OF REGION 5188.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE FOR M-CLASS FLARES AND A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN X-CLASS FLARE FROM REGION 5175.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS. A MINOR PROTON EVENT OCCURRED IN THE WAKE OF TODAY'S X-CLASS FLARE: IT BEGAN AT 12/0920Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 12 PFU (P CM-2 S-1 SR-1) AT 12/0930Z, AND ENDED AT 12/0945Z. NO SIGNIFICANT POLAR CAP ABSORPTION EVENT OCCURRED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE PROTON EVENT (MAXIMUM RECORDED ABSORPTION WAS .6 DB AT 12/1212Z).

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THE MINOR STORM CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S X-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. THE ENHANCED X-RAY BACK- GROUND LEVEL HAS STABILIZED. MUCH OF THE 2800 MHZ EAST-WEST SCAN ENERGY IS COMING FROM THE EXTREME EASTNORTHEAST NEAR-LIMB AREA. NEW REGION 5198 (N29E78) IS THE REMNANTS OF RETURNING REGION REGION 5159 (N29, L-314). THIS REGION AND THE IMMEDIATE AREA TO ITS SOUTHEAST PRODUCED MAJOR ACTIVITY DURING ITS LAST TOUR. BRIGHT SURGES OCCURRED FROM ITS GENERAL AREA MOST OF THE PERIOD. REGIONS 5197 (S17W77) AND 5199 (N33E06) WERE ALSO NUMBERED. TWO SMALL FILAMENTS DISAPPEARED FROM THE NORTHERN HEMISPHERE. ONE WAS ON THE BORDER OF A VERY WEAK CORONAL HOLE THAT PASSED CENTRAL MERIDIAN YESTERDAY.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THE CHANCE OF MODERATE ACTIVITY IS FAIR TO GOOD OVER THE THREE DAY PERIOD, AS THE EASTNORTHEAST AREA ROTATES FULLY ONTO THE DISK. DEPARTING REGION 5195 (S21W89) PROVIDES A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF PROTON PRODUCING FLARES THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE, WITH BRIEF STORM CONDITIONS, THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD. THIS DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO THE VERY WEAK CORONAL HOLE. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE TO UNSETTLED THE LAST HALF OF THE PERIOD.

IT AND THAT IMMEDIATE EASTNORTHEAST AREA WILL BE THE LOCATION OF ANY SIGNIFICNANT ACTIVITY. A SLIGHT DECREASING TREND OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS IS EXPECTED AS CURRENT ACTIVITY IS PROBABLY THE PEAK OF A QUICKER-THAN-USUAL INTERACTIVE LIFE-CYCLE.

SEVERAL OF TODAY'S FLARES WERE REMARKABLE IN THE PEAK FLUXES OF THE ASSOCIATED RADIO BURSTS AT 245 AND 410 MHZ, WITH SIX BURSTS OF GREATER THAN 500 S.F.U. SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB AT N25 (ASSOCIATED WITH REGION 5193), AND AT S23 (FROM REGION 5203). THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 23/2100Z
sections.text: TO 24/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5200 (N21W11) CONTINUES TO DOMINATE THE SOLAR DISK, PRODUCING NEARLY ALL OF TODAY'S FLARE ACTIVITY. THE LARGEST WERE A C6/SN AT 23/2200Z AND A C6/SN AT 24/2005Z. THE REGION APPEARS TO BE DECAYING SLOWLY WITH PENUMBRAL FRAGMENTATION PRIMARILY IN THE LEADER SPOTS. THE MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION IS ALSO SIMPLIFYING: THE CURRENT CONFIGURATION IS BASICALLY A BETA TYPE, ALTHOUGH SOME MIXED POLARITIES ARE VISIBLE IN FRONT OF THE LEADER SPOTS. A NEW REGION 5207 (S26E71) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY AS A SMALL, BIPOLAR, D-TYPE GROUP. NOTABLE SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB AT ABOUT N30 DURING THE PERIOD. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: GENERALLY LOW WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARES FROM REGION 5200.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 23/2100Z TO 24/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY QUIET WITH SOME BRIEF PERIODS OF UNSETTLED CONDITIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR MOST OF TOMORROW, BUT SHOULD BECOME UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LATE IN THE DAY OR EARLY ON THE SECOND DAY AS AN EXTENSION OF THE NORTHERN POLAR CORONAL HOLE (TO N20) WILL MOVE INTO A FAVORABLE LONGITUDE AT THAT TIME. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO MOSTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS ON THE THIRD DAY AS THE DISTURBANCE SUBSIDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 24/2100Z
sections.text: TO 25/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW. REGION 5200 (N21W24) PRODUCED TODAY'S LARGEST EVENT, A LONG DURATION C4.9/SF FLARE. THE GROUP CONTINUES TO DECLINE SLOWLY AND WAS LESS ERUPTIVE TODAY THAN ON PREVIOUS DAYS. LATE IN THE PERIOD, HOWEVER, THERE WAS SOME INDICATION THAT NEW GROWTH MAY HAVE STARTED IN THE LEADER PORTION OF THE REGION. REGIONS 5207 (S27E54) AND 5205 (N19E06) PRODUCED A COUPLE SUBFLARES. NEW REGION 5208 (N21E63) WAS ASSIGNED DURING THE PERIOD. MINOR SURGING OCCURRED ON THE WEST LIMB AT N30 AND ON THE EAST LIMB AT N20. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: AT GENERALLY LOW LEVELS WITH A CONTINUED CHANCE FOR MODERATE LEVELS. REGION 5200 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO DECLINE BUT THE CURRENT DYNAMICS COULD DESTABILIZE THE GROUP AND TRIGGER AN ISOLATED M-FLARE. OLD REGION 5175 (S16, L-156), WHICH PRODUCED THREE ENERGETIC FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN ON THE 27TH AND MAY ENHANCE ACTIVITY LEVELS AT THAT TIME.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 24/2100Z TO 25/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE TOMORROW IN RESPONSE TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE. CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED TO DECLINE TO PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED LEVELS WITH OCCASIONAL BRIEF PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN LOW WITH ONLY TWO C-CLASS FLARES IN THE LAST 24 HOURS. REGIONS 5200 (N21W36) AND 5207 (S26E43) WERE THE ONLY GROUPS OBSERVED TO PRODUCE WHAT LITTLE FLARE ACTIVITY OCCURRED. REGION 5200 IS STILL THE LARGEST GROUP ON THE DISK BUT CONTINUES TO DECAY SLOWLY AND QUIETLY. A NEW REGION 5209 (N29W41) EMERGED AS A SIMPLE BIPOLAR GROUP. sections.text: GENERALLY LOW. OLD REGION 5175 (S16, L-156), WHICH PRODUCED THREE ENERGETIC FLARES ON ITS PREVIOUS TRANSIT IS DUE TO RETURN TOMORROW. BECAUSE OF THE RETURN OF THIS REGION AND BECAUSE OF THE CONTINUED IMPRESSIVENESS OF THE SIZE OF REGION 5200 THERE IS A SLIGHT THREAT FOR MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED UNTIL LATE IN THE PERIOD WHEN CONDITIONS BECAME UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE. THE INCREASE MAY INDICATE THE BEGINNINGS OF CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS PREVIOUSLY FORECAST.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS TOMMOROW, AND IS EXPECTED TO BECOME MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED WITH OCCASIONAL BRIEF ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGH LATITUDES FOR THE SECOND AND THIRD DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE. SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON THE EAST LIMB AT ABOUT S10 AND ERUPTED INTO A M3.9/SF FLARE STARTING AT 1820Z AND REACHING MAXIMUM AT 1835Z. ASSOCIATED LOOPS WERE OBSERVED TO EXTEND OUT TO .03 RADII, AND OBSERVATIONS SUGGEST THAT MOST OF THE OPTICAL FLARE AREA WAS LOCATED BEHIND THE LIMB. THIS REGION WAS ASSIGNED SESC NUMBER 5212 AND IS PROBABLY THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5175. TWO OTHER NEW REGION ASSIGNMENTS WERE MADE: REGION 5210 (N29E23), A SIMPLE BIPOLAR GROUP, AND REGION 5211 (N15E65), A SIMPLE UNIPOLAR H-TYPE GROUP. THE LARGEST SUNSPOT REGION CURRENTLY ON THE DISK, REGION 5200 (N21W50), CONTINUED TO DECAY AND PRODUCED ONLY ONE SUBFLARE WITHOUT ANY SIGNIFICANT X-RAY ENHANCEMENTS. A SIGNIFICANT PORTION (ABOUT 75%) OF A FILAMENT CENTERED NEAR N56E30 DISAPPEARED SOMETIME EARLY IN THE PERIOD. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE QUIET AND STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: AT LOW TO MODERATE LEVELS. ALTHOUGH IT IS NOT YET POSSIBLE TO ANALYZE REGION 5212, THE GROUP IS PROBABLY CAPABLE OF PRODUCING ADDITIONAL ENERGETIC FLARES AND IS EXPECTED TO ENHANCE SOLAR ACTIVITY LEVELS DURING ITS TRANSIT OF THE SOLAR DISK.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 31/2100Z
sections.text: TO 01/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE.  NEW REGION 5218 (N11E69) PRODUCED AN M3/1N FLARE AT 01/1102Z.  THIS FLARE WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A TYPE IV SWEEP AND A RADIO BURST OF 160 FLUX UNITS AT 2695 MHZ.  THIS REGION ROTATED AROUND THE EAST LIMB AS A MODERATELY LARGE D-TYPE SUNSPOT GROUP.  REGION 5212 (S16E21) CONTINUES TO DEVELOP AND INCREASE IN COMPLEXITY. THIS REGION WAS THE PRIMARY CONTRIBUTOR TO A LONG DURATION (ABOUT THREE HOUR) C9.2 X-RAY ENHANCEMENT WHICH REACHED A MAXIMUM AT 01/1649Z.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE.  REGION 5218 COULD PRODUCE ANOTHER M-CLASS FLARE.  THE POSSIBILITY OF AN ISOLATED ENERGETIC FLARE FROM REGION 5212 WILL INCREASE AS THE REGION DEVELOPS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 01/2100Z
sections.text: TO 02/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE. REGION 5218 (S17E08) PRODUCED AN M1/SN AT 01/2151Z. MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS WERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE EVENT. THIS REGION HAS BEEN PRODUCING SUBFLARES THROUGHOUT THE DAY. REGION 5212 (N11E56) PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES AS WELL, THE LARGEST BEING A C5/SF 02/1001Z. RECENT OBSERVATIONS SUGGEST THAT A STRONG MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION HAS DEVELOPED IN THE TRAILER PORTION OF THE REGION. THE SOLAR MAXIMUM MISSION (SMM) SATELLITE DETECTED A LARGE CORONAL MASS EJECTION PROBABLY ASSOCIATED WITH THE LONG- DURATION C9/SF THAT OCCURRED AT 01/1649Z. ITS VELOCITY WAS DESCRIBED AS FASTER THAN AVERAGE. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. THERE IS A FAIR CHANCE FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY FROM REGIONS 5212 AND 5218.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE LEVELS AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS AT HIGH LATITUDES. THE HIGH LATITUDE STORMING IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE ON THE SECOND DAY DUE TO CORONAL HOLE EFFECTS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY HAS BEEN MODERATE. REGION 5212 (S17W45) PRODUCED AN M4/2B FLARE AT 06/1829Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A 120 FLUX UNIT TENFLARE AS WELL AS MINOR DISCRETE FREQUENCY BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM. REGION 5212 PRODUCED OCCASIONAL C-CLASS SUBFLARES PRIOR TO THE EVENT. REGION 5218 (N11E03) DISPLAYED A SMALL INCREASE IN MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY, BUT REMAINED RELATIVELY QUIET DURING THE PERIOD. NEW REGION 5224 (N24W67) EMERGED TODAY AS A SMALL UNIPOLE. TWO CORONAL MASS EJECTIONS WERE OBSERVED YESTERDAY. THE FIRST CME DEPARTED THE NORTHEAST LIMB NEAR 05/0445Z. ITS VELOCITY WAS UNKNOWN. THE SECOND DEPARTED THE SOUTHEAST LIMB BETWEEN 05/1100-1530Z AND WAS OF AVERAGE VELOCITY; ITS SOURCE MAY HAVE BEEN FROM BEHIND THE LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 5212 RETAINED ITS COMPLICATED MAGNETIC STRUCTURE IN THE WAKE OF THE M4/2B. THEREFORE, ADDITIONAL M-CLASS FLARES MAY OCCUR WITHIN THE REGION. THERE IS ALSO A VERY SLIGHT CHANCE FOR X-CLASS ACTIVITY FROM THIS REGION. REGION 5218 PROVIDES A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: TO 07/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5212 (S18W54) PRODUCED AN M3/1N FLARE AT 7/1111Z. NO SIGNIFICANT RADIO ASPECTS ACCOMPANIED THE EVENT. THE REGION RETAINED MUCH OF IT SIZE AND COMPLICATED MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. REGION 5218 (N12W10) ALSO EVOLVED TO A COMPLICATED MAGNETIC STRUCTURE, BUT ITS POTENTIAL ENERGY, AS DEPICTED BY MAGNETIC GRADIENT, IS COMPARATIVELY LESS THAN REGION 5212. A CME WAS OBSERVED BETWEEN 6/2212 AND 6/2337Z FROM THE SOUTHEAST LIMB. TWO SMALL REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED IN THE SOUTHEAST SECTOR. NEITHER PRODUCED ANY RECORDED EVENTS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5212 PROVIDES A GOOD CHANCE OF MODERATE, AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF HIGH ACTIVITY. IT ALSO SUPPORTS A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE. REGION 5218 INCREASINGLY PROVIDES A VERY SLIGHT TO SLIGHT CHANCE OF SIGNIFICANT LEVEL ACTIVITY AS IT CONTINUES TO DEVELOP GREATER MAGNETIC SHEAR.

sections.text: TO 08/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5218 (N12W24) PRODUCED A C3/2F FLARE WITH ASSOCIATED TYPES II AND IV RADIO SWEEPS AT 8/1253Z. THE 2695MHZ BURST WAS 130SFU. THIS REGION LOST SOME OF ITS SIZE IN THIS EVENT, BUT REMAINED MOSTLY THE SAME OVERALL. REGION 5212 (S17W69) PRODUCED LITTLE SIGNIFICANT ACTIVITY, AND ALSO RETAINED ITS GENERAL CONFIGURATION. sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS THE FIRST DAY AS THE CURRENT DISTURBANCE LEVELS RECOVER TO RECURRENTLY LOWER CONDITIONS. A DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE ON THE SECOND DAY IN RESPONSE TO THE C3/2F FLARE FROM REGION 5218 TODAY.

sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. REGION 5218 (N12W63) LOST SOME OF ITS COMPLICATED ASPECTS. IT ONLY PRODUCED A C7/1N FLARE WITH MINOR RADIO PARAMETERS. REGION 5212 (S17W108) ROTATED PAST THE WEST LIMB YESTERDAY, BUT CONTINUED TO SURGE AND PROBABLY WAS THE RESPONSIBLE SITE FOR MANY UNASSOCIATED LOW X-RAY EVENTS. sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5218 PROVIDES A VERY SLIGHT TO SLIGHT CHANCE OF BOTH HIGH ACTIVITY AND A PROTON PRODUCING FLARE. THE THREE ABUTTED REGIONS IN THE EASTNORTHEAST (5131-N13E47,5133 N15E61, AND 5135-N15E74) ARE CAPABLE OF INTERACTION AND A SLIGHT CHANCE OF MAJOR ACTIVITY.

sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OCCURRED AT 11/0753Z. IT MAY HAVE BEEN THE RESULT OF THE LDXE OF 8/1253Z THAT HAD ASSOCIATED TYPES II AND IV RADIO SWEEPS AND PRODUCED THE VERY WEAK 10MEV PROTON EVENT LATER THAT DAY. ACTIVE CONDITIONS STARTED VERY LATE TODAY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS

sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5229 (N33E31) GENERATED AN M5/2B TENFLARE AT 1615Z WITH TYPE II SWEEP. THE REGION PRODUCED LESSER FLARES TOO, AT A CADENCE OF ONE EVERY FOUR HOURS DURING THE INTERVAL. STRUCTURALLY IT POSSESSES A MODERATE DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. sections.text: AT THE MODERATE LEVEL. REGIONS 5229 AND 5218 (N12W75) ARE GOOD CANDIDATES FOR M-CLASS FLARES. ALSO, OLD REGION 5200 (N22, L=292), THE PRODUCER OF 6 M-CLASS FLARES LAST ROTATION, IS DUE AT EAST LIMB LATE TOMORROW.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. HIGH LATITUDES EXPERIENCED PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS. THIS SMALL DISTURBANCE MAY BE A CONSEQUENCE OF THE 08 NOV. FLARE ACTIVITY.

sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE ON 13 NOV. DUE TO A SMALL CORONAL HOLE NOW CENTERED NEAR N10W05. THIS DAY-LONG ACTIVITY SHOULD BE FOLLOWED BY UNSETTLED CONDITIONS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5229 (N32E18) PRODUCED THREE M-CLASS EVENTS IN THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE FLARES WERE: AN M7/1B TENFLARE WITH TYPE II AND IV SWEEP AT 0539Z; AN M3/1B WITH TYPE II AT 1635Z; AND AN M1/1N AT 2025Z. THE REGION CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 50 SPOTS, BRIGHT PLAGE, AND HAS UNDERGONE SUBSTANTIAL RESTRUCTURING SINCE YESTERDAY. THERE IS A SIGNIFICANT DEGREE OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY APPARENT IN THE SUNSPOT GROUP. REGION 5227 (S23W28) HAS ALSO EXHIBITED PRONOUNCED GROWTH AND HAS MERGED WITH REGION 5236 WHICH WAS LOCATED IMMEDIATELY TO THE EAST. THIS REGION GENERATED A C9/0F FLARE AT 1318Z. THREE NEW REGIONS WERE NUMBERED, THE MOST NOTEWORTHY BEING 5240 (N21E77) WHICH PRODUCED A FEW SUBFLARES. THIS NEW REGION IS IN THE GENERAL VICINITY OF OLD REGION 5200, EXPECTED TO RETURN LATE TODAY. AT WEST LIMB REGION 5218 (N13W86) IS SURGING AS IT LEAVES THE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: HIGH THE NEXT THREE DAYS. REGION 5229 HAS PROVEN ITSELF TO BE A PROLIFIC M-CLASS FLARE PRODUCER AND MAY YIELD AN ISOLATED X-CLASS EVENT DURING THE INTERVAL. REGIONS 5218, 5227, AND 5240 MAY ALSO CONTRIBUTE AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE ACTIVE THE NEXT 24 HOURS. A WELL-POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE, APPARENT IN TODAY'S 10830 DATA, SHOULD BEGIN TO AFFECT THE FIELD ANY TIME. UNSETTLED CONDITIONS WILL PREVAIL THE LAST TWO DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. THE NINE M-CLASS EVENTS THAT OCCURRED IN THE PAST 24 HOURS WERE ALMOST EQUALLY DISTRIBUTED AMONG THREE ACTIVE REGIONS. THE HIGHLIGHTS WERE: AN M3/1N TENFLARE WITH TYPE II AND IV SWEEP AT 0010Z FROM REGION 5227 (S23W40); AN M2/2B TENFLARE AT 1447Z FROM REGION 5229 (N32E05); AND AN M4/2B AT 1951Z FROM REGION 5240 (N21E59). ALL OF THESE REGIONS REMAIN COMPLEX AND POTENT AT THIS WRITING. A 20 DEGREE-LONG EAST-WEST FILAMENT DISAPPEARED FROM S45E20 VERY EARLY IN THE PERIOD. A NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION IS 5241 (N28E76). CALCIUM XV (YELLOW LINE) EMISSION WAS OBSERVED AT THAT SITE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO
sections.text: CONTINUE AT HIGH LEVELS. PERIODIC M-CLASS ACTIVITY SHOULD PERSIST FROM THE THREE MAIN ACTIVE CENTERS. AN ISOLATED X-CLASS EVENT IS LIKELY DURING THE NEXT 72 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED. A SMALL PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 0130Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 13 PFU AT 0235Z, AND ENDED AT 0310Z. PARTICLE DATA SUGGEST THE M3/1N FLARE FROM REGION 5227 AS THE LIKELY SOURCE OF THE PROTONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR MUCH OF THE NEXT TWO DAYS. TWO FACTORS MAY COMBINE TO GENERATE THE DISTURB- ANCE: A CORONAL HOLE NEAR N15W25 AND THE M3/1N FLARE AT 0010Z TODAY. THE ACTIVITY SHOULD ABATE BY THE END OF THE INTERVAL.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5254 (S19E42) PRODUCED AN M1/SF FLARE AT 26/2342Z AND REGION 5241 (N29W94) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 27/0829Z. THERE WERE NO SIGNIFICANT RADIO EMISSIONS ASSOCIATED WITH EITHER OF THESE FLARES. A TYPE II RADIO SWEEP BURST WAS DETECTED AT 27/0219Z IN CONJUNCTION WITH A C-CLASS SUBFLARE FROM REGION 5251 (N19E01). THREE NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED TODAY: 5256 (N23E02), A SIMPLE BIPOLE WHICH WAS FORMERLY CONSIDERED AS THE TRAILER PORTION OF 5251, 5257 (S17W08), A SMALL UNIPOLE, AND 5258 (N13E81), AN H-TYPE GROUP WHICH MAY BE THE RETURN OF OLD REGION 5218.

sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 5254 RETAINS A MODERATE LEVEL OF MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY PROVIDING A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.text: LOW. C-CLASS FLARES ARE LIKELY FROM REGIONS 5254 AND 5260. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN ISOLATED M-CLASS FLARE FROM EITHER OF THESE REGIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 29/2100Z TO 30/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT QUIET TO UNSETTLED LEVELS UNTIL 30/0800Z. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 47 NANOTESLAS OCCURRED AT 30/0801Z. THEREAFTER, THE FIELD WAS AT MINOR TO MAJOR STORM LEVELS. THESE EFFECTS MAY HAVE BEEN IN RESPONSE TO A LARGE SOUTHERN POLAR CROWN FILAMENT THAT DISAPPEARED LATE ON 27 NOVEMBER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MOSTLY ACTIVE LEVELS TOMORROW AS THE PRESENT DISTURBANCE DECLINES. THE FIELD IS EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 05/2100Z
sections.text: TO 06/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. A 28 DEGREE LONG FILAMENT HAD DISAPPEARED FROM THE SOUTHWEST QUADRANT VERY EARLY IN THE PERIOD. THE NORTHNORTHWEST FILAMENT, REFERRED TO YESTERDAY, WAS 48 DEGREES LONG AND WAS ALSO COMPLETELY GONE BY VERY EARLY IN THIS PERIOD (5/2216Z). THE OVERALL BACKGROUND X-RAY FLUX HAS RISEN TO MAINTAIN A CONSISTENT LOW ACTIVITY THRESHOLD (C1.0) LEVEL.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW. THE RETURNING ACTIVE CARRINGTON SECTOR FROM 010 BACK TO 300 IN THE NORTHERN HEMISPHERE SUPPORTS INCREASING FLARE CHANCES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 05/2100Z TO 06/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED. THE DISAPPEARING FILAMENTS OF VERY LATE IN THE GMT DAY OF 05 DEC WILL PROBABLY NOT AFFECT US DUE TO THEIR MIDDLE AND HIGH LATITUDE LOCATIONS. THE IMPROBABLE DISTURBANCE ONSET, IF IT DID OCCUR, WOULD PROBABLY START DURING THE SECOND DAY (8 DEC) AND PEAK EARLY ON THE THIRD DAY (9 DEC). ALTHOUGH NOT LIKELY, THIS DISTURBANCE WOULD BE AT STORM LEVELS IF PORPORTIONAL TO THE MASS OF THE FILAMENTS THAT DISAPPEARED.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 08/2100Z
sections.text: TO 09/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5265 (N19E08) PRODUCED NEARLY ALL OF THE FLARES OBSERVED DURING THE INTERVAL, AMONG THEM AN M2/1N AT 0320Z AND AN M3/0N AT 0737Z. BOTH OF THOSE IMPULSIVE EVENTS WERE ACCOMPANIED BY MODEST DISCRETE FREQUENCY RADIO BURSTS. THE H-ALPHA FLARES WERE LARGELY CONFINED TO THE PLAGE IMMEDIATELY WEST OF THE MAIN SPOT, PERHAPS THE SITE OF AN ISOLATED POLE. ELSEWHERE, TWO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 5272 (S15E63) AND 5273 (S33E72). MINOR SURGING WAS REPORTED AT BOTH LIMBS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5265 SHOULD CONTINUE TO GENERATE M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 08/2100Z TO 09/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS, MARKING THE FIFTH CONSECUTIVE DAY OF QUIET CONDITIONS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST PERIOD.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 09/2100Z
sections.text: TO 10/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. A REGION THAT IS NOW PERHAPS ONE DAY BEHIND EAST LIMB PRODUCED A LONG-DURATION (FIVE HOURS) M2 X-RAY FLARE WITH TYPE II AND IV AT 1450Z. WEATHER HAMPERED OPTICAL PATROLS ALL DAY, BUT ONE SITE DID REPORT POST-FLARE LOOPS AT N28. THAT IS THE APPROXIMATE LOCATION OF OLD REGION 5241 (N28, L=291) WHICH PRODUCED M-CLASS ACTIVITY DURING ITS WEST LIMB PASSAGE AND IS DUE BACK TOMORROW. REGION 5265 (N20W06) GENERATED AN M2/1N EVENT WITH TYPE IV AT 9/2118Z AND ALSO AN M1 AT 1654Z TODAY. SECTIONS OF A LARGE BUSHY FILAMENT THAT EXTENDED FROM N40W00 TO N15W20 DISAPPEARED DURING THE INTERVAL. A NEW REGION, 5274 (N33E47), WAS ASSIGNED.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. WATCH EAST LIMB NEAR N28 AS WELL AS REGION 5265 FOR ADDITIONAL M-CLASS ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 09/2100Z TO 10/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET EARLY, BECOMING UNSETTLED AND EVEN SLIGHTLY ACTIVE AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED THE NEXT TWO DAYS. UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE CONDITIONS MAY OCCUR 13 DEC. AS RECENT DISAPPEARING FILAMENT AND FLARE ACTIVITY MAY SPAWN A SHORT DISTURBANCE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 10/2100Z
sections.text: TO 11/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY CONTINUES MODERATE. NEWLY NUMBERED REGION 5275 (S32E55), FORMERLY THOUGHT TO BE THE TRAILER PORTION OF REGION 5273 (S31E42), PRODUCED AN M1/0F FLARE AT 10/2304Z AND ANOTHER M1/0F AT 1029Z. IT ALSO YIELDED NUMEROUS SMALLER FLARES, SOME OF WHICH WERE ACCOMPANIED BY SYMPATHETIC ACTIVITY IN REGION 5273. THIS COMPLEX IS LENGTHY AND BRIGHT AS TODAY'S LARGE INCREASE IN THE 10 CM. FLUX WILL ATTEST. REGION 5265 (N20W19) HAS BEEN GENERALLY QUIET AND STABLE. TWO OTHER NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED: 5276 (S12E02) AND 5277 (S13W34). ANOTHER REGION WAS EXPECTED NEAR N28 EAST LIMB, THE SITE OF YESTERDAY'S FLARE LOOPS, BUT HAS YET TO APPEAR ON THE VISIBLE DISK.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS ANTICIPATED FROM REGIONS 5265 AND 5275 DURING THE NEXT 72 HOURS. ALSO, WATCH THE NORTH- EAST LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 10/2100Z TO 11/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED THE FIRST HALF OF THE PERIOD. ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS PREVAIL- ED MOST RECENTLY. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OCCURRED AT 1827Z AND IT MEASURED 6 NANOTESLAS AT BOULDER. THIS ACTIVITY MAY BE RELATED TO A SMALL CORONAL HOLE POSSIBLY LOCATED NEAR N10W35. THIS IS ASSUMING THAT THE CORONAL HOLE VISIBLE ON DEC. 6, THE LAST DATA RECEIVED, HAS PERSISTED.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE THE NEXT THREE DAYS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 11/2100Z
sections.text: TO 12/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS LOW. SEVERAL SMALL, C-CLASS FLARES WERE OBSERVED, THE LARGEST OF WHICH WAS A C7/1N FROM REGION 5269 (N31W00) AT 0743Z. NEW REGION 5278 (N26E74) ROTATED INTO VIEW TODAY AS AN IMPRESSIVE D-TYPE GROUP BUT WAS OBSERVED TO PRODUCE ONLY STABLE SURGE ACTIVITY. ADDITIONAL SURGE ACTIVITY WAS OBSERVED ON THE WEST LIMB AT N20. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE ESSENTIALLY STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: LOW TO MODERATE. REGION 5278 AND ABUTTED REGIONS 5273/5275 ARE CONSIDERED TO BE THE MOST LIKELY SOURCES FOR M-CLASS OR GREATER ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 11/2100Z TO 12/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED. A PERIOD OF ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM CONDITIONS OCCURRED FROM 0300-0600Z. THE INCREASE OF ACTIVITY MAY BE RELATED TO A FAVORABLY POSITIONED CORONAL HOLE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED. SOME BRIEF ISOLATED ACTIVE PERIODS MAY OCCUR AT HIGHER LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 12/2100Z
sections.text: TO 13/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5278 (N25E66) PRODUCED AN M2/SF FLARE AT 0218Z WHICH WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP. THIS REGION PRODUCED SURGING ALL DAY AS MORE SPOTS CONTINUED TO ROTATE INTO VIEW: THE AVERAGE AREAL COVERAGE IS NOW 750 MILLIONTHS. REGIONS 5275 (S33E30), 5265 (N20W47), AND 5269 (N32W11) ALSO CONTRIBUTED SMALL FLARES. NEW REGION 5279 (N21E39) EMERGED DURING THE PERIOD. THE REMAINDER OF THE DISK AND LIMBS WERE STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5278 IS CONSIDERED TO BE THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR M-CLASS OR GREATER FLARES. THERE CONTINUES TO BE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SUCH ACTIVITY FROM REGIONS 5275 AND 5273.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 12/2100Z TO 13/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS GENERALLY UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE, WITH SOME ISOLATED PERIODS OF MINOR STORM CONDITIONS AT HIGH LATITUDES, PARTICULARLY IN THE LATTER PART OF THE DAY. THE DISTURBANCE MAY HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY EITHER THE LONG DURATION M2 FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON 10 DECEMBER, OR BY A FILAMENT THAT ERUPTED FROM THE DISK BETWEEN 09 AND 10 DECEMBER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE PREDOMINANTLY UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. ISOLATED PERIODS OF ACTIVE CONDITIONS MAY PERSIST AT HIGHER LATITUDES TOMORROW.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 13/2100Z
sections.text: TO 14/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5278 (N25E56) PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS FLARES: AN M2/1B AT 1339Z AND AN M1/SN AT 1741Z. THIS GROUP IS THE MOST IMPRESSIVE ON THE DISK AT THIS TIME, COVERING AN AREA OF ABOUT 820 MILLIONTHS AND POSSESSING A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE LARGE LEADER PENUMBRA. REGION 5273 (S31E03) ALSO CONTRIBUTED AN M1/SF AT 2039Z, AND TOGETHER WITH REGION 5275 FORMS A COMPLICATED PAIR OF MATURE REGIONS. NEW REGION 5280 (N27E74) WAS IDENTIFIED TODAY CLOSE BEHIND REGION 5278 AS A SEPERATE BIPOLE. SURING ACTIVITY HAS BEEN OBSERVED ALL DAY ON THE EAST LIMB AT ABOUT N30, SUGGESTING THAT YET ANOTHER REGION MAY ROTATE INTO VIEW. A FEW OF THE OTHER REGIONS WERE OBSERVED TO GROW SOMEWHAT, NOTEABLY REGION 5279 (N21E24), WHICH PRODUCED SOME RESPECTABLE C-CLASS FLARES. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE ESSENTIALLY STABLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5278 IS THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR M-CLASS OR GREATER FLARES. REGIONS 5273, 5275, 5280, AND 5279 ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF RAISING ACTIVITY TO MODERATE LEVELS. THERE IS A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR AN X-CLASS OR PROTON PRODUCING EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 13/2100Z TO 14/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED UNTIL ABOUT 1800Z WHEN CONDITIONS BECAME UNSETTLED TO ACTIVE. THE GREATER THAN 10MEV PROTON FLUXES BEGAN TO SHOW SOME ENHANCEMENTS BEGINNING AT ABOUT 1330Z BUT DID NOT REACH EVENT LEVELS. THE MOST LIKELY SOURCE OF THE ENHANCEMENT IS THE 13/0218Z M2 FLARE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS WITH OCCASIONAL ACTIVE PERIODS AT HIGHER LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 14/2100Z
sections.text: TO 15/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5278 (N26E44) PRODUCED AN X1/1N FLARE AT 0509Z. THE EVENT LASTED JUST OVER TWO HOURS AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH SIGNIFICANT RADIO BURSTS, INCLUDING A TENFLARE, A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP, AND A TYPE IV SWEEP. THE ONLY OTHER CLASS M OR GREATER FLARE WAS AN M1 AT 0729Z WHICH WAS NOT OBSERVED OPTICALLY. NUMEROUS ADDITIONAL C-CLASS FLARES WERE PRODUCED WITH CONTRIBUTIONS FROM 5279 (N21E10) AND 5273 (S32W09). THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE STABLE AND QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE WITH A CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE FOR X-CLASS FLARES OR PROTON EVENT PRODUCING FLARES. REGION 5278 CONTINUES TO BE THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR M-CLASS OR GREATER FLARES, AND REGIONS 5273 AND 5279 ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF RAISING ACTIVITY TO MODERATE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 14/2100Z TO 15/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET TO UNSETTLED, WITH SOME BRIEF ISOLATED PERIODS OF ACTIVE LEVELS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO ATTAIN ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS IN RESPONSE TO TODAY'S X-CLASS X-RAY EVENT. THE DISTURBANCE IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN LATE TOMORROW, REACH PEAK INTENSITY ON THE SECOND DAY, AND SUBSIDE LATE ON THE THIRD DAY. A PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN NEAR MID-DAY TOMORROW IN RESPONSE TO THE FLARE AND IS EXPECTED TO REACH A MAXIMUM OF ABOUT 50 PFU LATE TOMORROW.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 15/2100Z
sections.text: TO 16/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5278 (N27E30) PRODUCED AN X4/1B FLARE AT 0846Z WHICH LASTED ABOUT 3 HOURS, HAD A TOTAL INTEGRATED FLUX OF 1.1 JOULES/SQUARE-METER, WAS ASSOCIATED WITH VERY STRONG DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS AND A STRONG TYPE IV SWEEP. SUPRISINGLY, THIS WAS THE ONLY FLARE THE REGION PRODUCED DURING THE 24 HOUR PERIOD THAT WAS M-CLASS OR GREATER. THE REGION CONTINUES TO BE IMPRESSIVE WITH A MAGNETIC DELTA CONFIGURATION IN THE LARGE LEADER SPOT. REGION 5279 (N23W03) PRODUCED AN M1/1B FLARE AT 15/2132Z AND CONTINUED TO FLUCTUATE TO SUB-FLARE LEVEL THROUGHOUT THE DAY. A SURGE REGION ON THE EAST LIMB AT N17 PRODUCED SUBFLARE LEVEL ACTIVITY DURING THE DAY AND WAS ASSIGNED SESC REGION NUMBER 5283. A NEW REGION 5282 (S23E43) EMERGED ON THE DISK. THE REMAINDER OF THE SOLAR DISK AND LIMBS WERE ESSENTIALLY STABLE ALTHOUGH REGIONS 5280, 5273 PRODUCED NUMEROUS SUBFLARE FLUCTUATIONS DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 5278 IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AS THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR M-CLASS AND GREATER FLARES. REGIONS 5273, 5279, AND 5280 ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF PRODUCING MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 15/2100Z TO 16/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET UNTIL 0900Z WHEN ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVEL CONDITIONS BEGAN. THE GREATER THAN 10MEV PARTICLE FLUX LEVELS ROSE DURING THE PERIOD AND APPEAR TO BE COUNTINUING ON AN UPWARD TREND AT THIS TIME: THE PEAK PARTICLE FLUX SO FAR HAS BEEN 8 PFU. THESE EFFECTS ARE PROBABLY THE RESULT OF THE X1/1N FLARE THAT OCCURRED AT 15/0509Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT MOSTLY MINOR STORM CONDITIONS OVER THE NEXT THREE DAYS. THIS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED AS CONSEQUENCE OF CONTINUED EFFECTS FROM THE X1 FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON THE 15TH AND IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE SECOND AND THIRD DAY AS A RESULT OF TODAY'S X4 FLARE. A PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN AND PEAK AT ABOUT 130 PFU SOMETIME IN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 16/2100Z
sections.text: TO 17/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5278 (N27E18) CONTINUES TO BE IMPRESSIVE IN STRUCTURE, MAINTAINING A STRONG DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. IT PRODUCED TWO M-CLASS EVENTS DURING THE PERIOD: THE FIRST WAS AN M3/SF FLARE AT 17/0502Z ACCOMPANIED BY SIGNIFICANT DISCRETE RADIO BURSTS (INCLUDING A 280 SOLAR FLUX UNIT TENFLARE), A STRONG TYPE II SWEEP BURST, AND A TYPE IV SWEEP; THE SECOND WAS AN M2/SF FLARE AT 17/0542Z WITH MINOR RADIO EMISSIONS. REGION 5273 (S31W34) PRODUCED AN M2/SN FLARE AT 17/0348Z. REGION 5272 (S11W43) PRODUCED AN M1/1B FLARE AT 17/1750Z. THE SOLAR MAXIMUM MISSION SATELLITE OBSERVED A LARGE CORONAL MASS EJECTION FROM THE EAST LIMB. THE CME WAS FIRST OBSERVED AT 16/0830Z, WHICH COINCIDES WITH THE X4 FLARE THAT OCCURRED NEAR THAT TIME. IT EXCEEDED 100 DEGRESS IN EXTENT AND HAD A VELOCITY IN EXCESS OF 1500 KM SEC-1. NO NEW REGIONS WERE ASSIGNED DURING THE PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 5278 REMAINS THE PRIMARY THREAT FOR M-CLASS AND GREATER FLARES. REGIONS 5272, 5273, 5279 (N23W14), AND 5280 (N26E32) ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF MODERATE ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 16/2100Z TO 17/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT QUIET TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. A SUDDEN IMPULSE OF 15 NANOTESLAS OCCURRED AT 17/1824Z AND IS MOST LIKELY A MANEFESTATION OF THE X4 FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON 16 DECEMBER. A GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 17/0610Z, REACHED A MAXIMUM OF 18 PFU AT 17/0855Z, AND ENDED AT 17/1440Z. THE MAXIMUM POLAR CAP ABSORPTION ASSOCIATED WITH THIS EVENT WAS 0.6 DECIBELS. A SECOND GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT BEGAN AT 17/2000Z AND IS CURRENTLY IN PROGRESS. INDICATIONS ARE THAT THE PRESENT EVENT WILL BE SIMILAR IN MAGNITUDE TO THE PRECEEDING PROTON EVENT.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT MINOR STORM LEVELS DURING THE FIRST DAY OF THE PERIOD DECLINING TO ACTIVE LEVELS DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD. THIS ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED IN RESPONSE TO THE X4 FLARE OF 16 DECEMBER. THE CURRENT GREATER THAN 10 MEV PROTON EVENT IS EXPECTED TO END SOMETIME DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 17/2100Z
sections.text: TO 18/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5273 (S30W45) PRODUCED AN X1/3B FLARE AT 18/1705Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY MINOR DISCRETE FREQUENCY BURSTS ACROSS THE SPECTRUM. A WEAK TYPE II SWEEP BURST (WITH ESTIMATED VELOCITY BETWEEN 1200-1600 KM SEC-1) ALSO OCCURRED DURING THE FLARE. REGION 5278 (N27E04) PRODUCED SEVERAL SUBFLARES DURING THE PERIOD. THE LARGEST OF THESE WAS AN M1/SN FLARE AT 18/0917Z. SLIGHT RELAXATION OF THE MAGNETIC GRADIENTS OCCURRED WITHIN THIS REGION DURING THE PERIOD, BUT IT REMAINS IMPRESSIVE IN MORPHOLOGICAL ASPECTS. REGION 5282 (S21E16) PRODUCED AN M1/1N FLARE AT 18/1640Z. THE FLARE WAS ACCOMPANIED BY A SIGNIFICANT DISCRETE BURST AT 245 MHZ AND A MAJOR DISCRETE BURST (35000 SFU) AT 410 MHZ. THREE NEW REGIONS EMERGED TODAY: 5284 (N32E54), 5285 (N20E74), AND 5286 (N25W48). ALL WERE STRUCTURALLY SIMPLE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGIONS 5278 AND 5273 ARE THE PRIMARY THREATS FOR MODERATE OR GREATER LEVELS OF ACTIVITY. REGIONS 5279 (N22W27), 5280 (N27E18), AND 5282 ARE CAPABLE OF PRODUCING MODERATE LEVELS OF ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 17/2100Z TO 18/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. THIS ACTIVITY WAS PROBABLY IN RESPONSE TO THE X4 FLARE OF 16 DECEMBER. THE PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV THAT BEGAN AT 17/2000Z REACHED ITS MAXIMUM OF 29 PFU AT 18/0150Z AND ENDED AT 18/1700Z.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. MINOR STORMING IS MOST LIKELY TO OCCUR ON THE SECOND DAY OF THE PERIOD IN RESPONSE TO THE X1/3B FLARE THAT OCCURRED TODAY. A PROTON EVENT AT GREATER THAN 10 MEV IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN BEFORE 19/0000Z WITH A MAXIMUM PREDICTED FLUX OF 63 PFU EXPECTED NEAR 19/0000Z. THIS IS ALSO AN EXPECTED RESULT OF TODAY'S X-FLARE.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 18/2100Z
sections.text: TO 19/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5279 (N23W39) PRODUCED AN M1/1B FLARE AT 19/0047Z. REGION 5285 (N22E63) PRODUCED AN M1/SN FLARE AT 19/1850Z. NO SIGNIFICANT RADIO EMISSIONS WERE OBSERVED WITH EITHER OF THESE EVENTS. REGION 5278 (N27W09) WAS QUIET DURING THE PERIOD DESPITE ITS COMPLEX STRUCTURE; IT RETAINED ITS BETA-GAMMA-DELTA MAGNETIC CONFIGURATION. NEWLY ASSIGNED REGION 5287 (N17E01) EMERGED TODAY AND ENTERED A VERY RAPID GROWTH PHASE. THUS FAR THE REGION HAS BEEN QUIET.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH. REGION 5278 HAS THE POTENTIAL FOR PRODUCING M- AND X-CLASS ACTIVITY. M-CLASS ACTIVITY IS ALSO POSSIBLE FROM REGIONS 5273 (S31W57), 5279, 5280 (N27E04), 5285, AND 5287.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 18/2100Z TO 19/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD HAS BEEN AT UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE MINOR STORMING IS PROBABLY RELATED TO THE X4 FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON 16 DECEMBER.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE AT ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM LEVELS. MINOR STORMING IS MOST LIKELY TO OCCUR TOMORROW AS A RESULT OF THE X1/3B FLARE THAT OCCURRED ON 18 DECEMBER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 19/2100Z
sections.text: TO 20/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH.  AN M7 X-RAY FLARE OCCURRED AT 20/1244Z AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A STRONG TYPE II/IV RADIO SWEEP AND A 2695 MHZ RADIO BURST OF 690 SFU.  OPTICAL CORRELATION WAS NOT DEFINITE, ALTHOUGH THERE IS EVIDENCE THAT THE SOUTHEAST LIMB MAY BE THE SOURCE.  REGION 5278 (N27W24) IS STILL THE LARGEST AND MOST COMPLEX REGION ON THE DISK BUT HAS NOT PRODUCED MAJOR FLARE ACTIVITY DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE TO HIGH.  REGIONS 5278, 5280 (N26W10), 5285 (N21E51), AND THE NEW REGION BEYOND THE SOUTHEAST LIMB (IF IT EXISTS) MAY PRODUCE ENERGETIC ACTIVITY.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 19/2100Z TO 20/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS MOSTLY QUIET.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE QUIET TO UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND UNSETTLED TO MINOR STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 20/2100Z
sections.text: TO 21/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE DUE TO AN M1/SF FLARE IN REGION 5273 (S32W80) AT 21/1557Z.  OTHER DISK REGIONS PRODUCED ONLY MINOR SUBFLARES.  REGION 5278 (N27W35) HAS DECLINED IN COMPLEXITY SINCE YESTERDAY.  NEW REGION 5288 (S32W43) IS A RAPIDLY EMERGING BIPOLE.  NEW SMALL SPOTS ARE ROTATING AROUND THE EAST LIMB NEAR NE17 BUT HAVE NOT YET BEEN NUMBERED.  AN ACTIVE REGION IS STILL EXPECTED TO ROTATE ONTO THE DISK NEAR SE17, THE BELIEVED SOURCE OF YESTERDAY'S M7 X-RAY FLARE.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE.  THE POTENTIAL FOR ENERGETIC ACTIVITY FROM THE REGIONS CURRENTLY ON THE DISK HAS DECLINED.  A NEW ACTIVE REGION, WHICH MAY ELEVATE ACTIVITY LEVELS, IS EXPECTED TO ROTATE INTO VIEW NEAR SE17 WITHIN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 20/2100Z TO 21/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS QUIET TO UNSETTLED .

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD IS
sections.text: EXPECTED TO BE MOSTLY UNSETTLED AT MIDDLE LATITUDES AND ACTIVE TO MINOR STORM AT HIGH LATITUDES.  ACTIVE CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED ON 23 DECEMBER DUE TO THE M7 FLARE ON 20 DECEMBER.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 22/2100Z
sections.text: TO 23/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5280 (N25W53) PRODUCED AN M5/1N FLARE AT 22/2326Z WITH STRONG TYPE II AND MODERATE TYPE IV EMISSIONS. REGION 5275 (S33W87) PRODUCED AN M1/SF FLARE AT 23/0859Z WITH A LOOP PROMINENCE SYSTEM AND AN M1 AT 23/1443Z WITH A TYPE II AND SPRAY TO .51R ABOVE THE LIMB. MOST REGIONS CONTINUE A SLOW DECAY. AT LEAST 6 CORONAL MASS EJECTIONS WERE OBSERVED FROM THE NORTHWEST AND SOUTHWEST LIMBS SINCE 22/1900Z. A CORONAL HOLE, NEWLY FORMED FROM LAST ROTATION, IS CENTERED NEAR S14E02 WITH ITS LEADING EDGE NEAR W14.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD
sections.text: BE AT A GENERALLY MODERATE LEVEL FOR THE NEXT 3 DAYS. THE FREQUENCY OF M CLASS ACTIVITY SHOULD DECREASE AS WESTERN HEMISPHERE REGIONS TRANSIT THE LIMB.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY SUMMARY FROM 22/2100Z TO 23/2100Z:
sections.text: THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD WAS AT QUIET LEVELS FOR THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE DISTURBANCE EXPECTED FOR TODAY FAILED TO MATERIALIZE.

sections.title: GEOPHYSICAL ACTIVITY FORECAST:  THE GEOMAGNETIC FIELD
sections.text: SHOULD RANGE FROM UNSETTLED TO SLIGHTLY ACTIVE FOR 24 AND 25 DEC. ACTIVE LEVELS, WITH SHORT PERIODS OF MINOR STORMING, ARE FORECAST FOR 26 DEC IN RESPONSE TO THE CORONAL HOLE NOW CENTERED NEAR CENTRAL MERIDIAN.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 25/2100Z
sections.text: TO 26/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS HIGH. REGION 5292 (S17E20) PRODUCED AN M6/1B AT 26/2043Z. VERY LITTLE RADIO EMISSION WAS OBSERVED WITH THE FLARE. REGION 5292 EVOLVED RAPIDLY DURING THE PERIOD WITH DRAMATIC INCREASES IN AREA AND MAGNETIC COMPLEXITY. THIS REGION ALSO PRODUCED AN M1/1N AT 26/2022Z. REGION 5290 (N22E10) GREW SLIGHTLY DURING THE PAST 24 HOURS. THE WEST LIMB OUTER CORONA CONTINUED TO BE DISTURBED - THE LATEST MASS EJECTION REPORTED BY THE SMM CORONAGRAPH WAS 24/1230-1500Z FROM THE SOUTHWEST LIMB.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY SHOULD BE
sections.text: GENERALLY MODERATE FOR THE NEXT THREE DAYS. AS WITH THE M6 FLARE TODAY, ISOLATED MID LEVEL CLASS M FLARES ARE POSSIBLE. SHOULD THE CURRENT GROWTH TREND CONTINUE IN REGION 5292, MID LEVEL M AND HIGHER FLARES SHOULD BECOME MORE FREQUENT.

sections.title: ANALYSIS OF SOLAR ACTIVE REGIONS AND ACTIVITY FROM 26/2100Z
sections.text: TO 27/2100Z:  SOLAR ACTIVITY WAS MODERATE. REGION 5285 (N21W38) PRODUCED AN M1/0F FLARE WITH SMALL RADIO BURSTS AND A MODERATE TYPE II SWEEP AT 27/0533Z. AN UNCORRELATED X-RAY FLARE OCCURRED AT 27/0736Z AND WAS PROBABLY JUST BEHIND THE WEST LIMB AT EITHER N27 OR S24. OPTICAL REPORTS OF SPRAY, AND A DISAPPEARING AND/OR ERUPTIVE PROMINENCE AT THOSE LOCATIONS (RESPECTIVELY) COINCIDED WITH THE X-RAY EVENT. THE MAXIMUM WAS M1 AND WAS ASSOCIATED WITH A TYPE II AND IV RADIO SWEEP, AS WELL AS SMALL BURSTS. A CME WAS ALSO REPORTED FROM THE NORTHWEST LIMB. REGION 5292 (S17E05) SIMPLIFIED TO AN AVERAGE MAGNETIC TYPE AFTER ITS MAJOR FLARE YESTERDAY JUST BEFORE THE START OF THIS PERIOD.

sections.title: SOLAR ACTIVITY FORECAST:  SOLAR ACTIVITY IS EXPECTED TO BE
sections.text: MODERATE. REGION 5285 EVOLVED INTO A COMPLICATED MAGNETIC TYPE AND SUPPORTS A CONTINUING VERY SLIGHT CHANCE OF MAJOR ACTIVITY. REGION 5297 (S15E35) EMERGED TODAY AS A SLIGHTLY UNUSUAL BETA- GAMMA BUT DOES NOT CONTAIN QUITE AS MUCH POTENTIAL AS EITHER 5292 OR 5285.
